description.hltext_display: ´Piwi´ espera conseguir hoy la ficha federativa
description.author: La Opinión de Málaga
description.content: R. M. G. MÁLAGA El Clínicas Rincón ya le ha hecho sitio a ´Piwi´ García, que ocupará la plaza de extracomunitario que deja libre el pívot estadounidense James Keefe. Tras un par de meses en el club, Keefe se marcha al Tíjola de LEB Plata, por lo que el puertorriqueño y Zamora serán los americanos del filial. El Unicaja y Tíjola guardan excelentes relaciones. De hecho, el conjunto de García Reneses se estrenó esta pretemporada en un encuentro amistoso en tierras almerienses. Ángel García, como ayer adelantó Manolo Rubia, tiene previsto debutar hoy mismo con el Clínicas, que juega esta noche la decimoquinta jornada de la LEB Oro en la pista del Fundación Adepal Alcázar a las 20.45 horas. Paco Aurioles tendrá hoy bajo sus órdenes en Alcázar de San Juan (Ciudad Real) al nuevo promesa verde, un puertorriqueño criado en Chicago de 2,09 metros aspirante a ser el nuevo Nowitzki. Eso, claro, siempre y cuando la Federación tramite su alta. El chico viajó ayer sin ella y el club espera poder dar de alta hoy al jugador.

description.hltext_display: Fêtes: pas de remèdes miracles contre la gueule de bois
description.content:
Les manifestations de ce qu’on appelle veisalgie sont bien connues : bouche sèche, vrilles dans la tête, nausées, déshydratation... Contrairement à ce qu’on pense souvent, la gueule de bois n’intervient pas au soir de la fête mais commence quand le taux d’alcool diminue dans le sang. Elle est à son sommet au bout de plusieurs heures, quand il est redescendu à zéro. En 2008, le National Geographic présentait un tableau des remèdes préconisés dans plusieurs pays.
Il y a aux Etats-Unis le mélange jus de tomate/jaune d’oeuf cru/sauce Worcestershire, en Chine un thé vert fort, une citronnade ou de l’eau vinaigrée, en Roumanie une soupe de tripes, au Mexique une salade de crevettes bien assaisonnée qu’on appelle "retour à la vie", en Pologne du jus de cornichon amer... Aux Pays-Bas, on imagine combattre le mal par le mal en buvant de la bière.En tête des congés maladies
Rester au lit longuement le matin, prostré dans son mal-être, est une solution souvent adoptée puisque, selon une étude britannique, la gueule de bois arrive en tête des causes des congés maladie.
Mais tous les spécialistes l’affirment : ce qui est pris avant les agapes ne sert pas à grand chose. La cuillerée d’huile aide seulement à ne pas entamer la soirée l’estomac vide, ce qui favoriserait une montée encore plus rapide du taux d’alcool.
Pendant la soirée, les alcools clairs (comme le vin blanc ou la vodka) vaudraient mieux que les alcools sombres (comme le vin rouge ou le whisky), et il est souhaitable de ne pas les mélanger. Boire de temps en temps un verre d’eau ferait du bien.
Ce que l’on tente après pour limiter les dégâts n’est pas plus utile. Boire beaucoup d’eau peut faire un peu de bien (contre la déshydratation) ou encore du bouillon (pour les sels minéraux). Quelques médicaments peuvent aider comme l’ibuprofène ou le paracétamol, mieux que l’aspirine. Si on a un peu faim, des céréales, du sucre vaudront mieux que de la nourriture salée.Boissons prétendument dégrisantes
"Eliminer l’alcool rapidement, dégriser et retrouver ses esprits, prendre le volant en toute sécurité, voilà de quoi faire rêver", relève la DGCCRF (Direction générale de la concurrence, de la consommation et de la répression des fraudes), dans une brochure de conseils "Pour des fêtes réussies".
Du rêve sur lequel se sont jetées les boissons prétendument dégrisantes qui se vantent de réduire le taux d’alcool dans le sang, sans preuve scientifique à l’appui, affirme l’Anses (agence sanitaire de l’alimentation). "A ce jour, aucune denrée alimentaire alléguant ses capacités à réduire l’alcoolémie n’a réussi à démontrer son efficacité", martèle la DGCCRF.
Les promoteurs belges de l’Outox continuent cependant à affirmer qu’il "accélère la baisse naturelle du taux d’alcool" et "prévient les lendemains difficiles". Ils se sont pourvus en justice contre la DGCCRF, qui parle de "publicité mensongère".
Au bout du compte, il faut admettre que la seule manière d’éviter la gueule de bois c’est la modération, voire, comme le dit l’Anses, "l’alcoolémie égale à zéro".
"La gueule de bois est l’un de ces problèmes où la prévention est plus importante que le traitement", relevait il y a quelques années le médecin allemand Edzard Ernst.

description.hltext_display: Spalletti se desmarca del Inter
description.author: Jordi Archs
description.content:
"Por el momento Rafael Benítez todavía es el entrenador del Inter". Así se expresó Massimo Moratti, presidente y dueño del club 'nerazzurro', al final de otra jornada en que todo el mundo volvió a dar por hecha la destitución del técnico español. Falta sólo la confirmación oficial que, como informó MD en su edición de ayer, se producirá hoy si finalmente ambas partes llegan a un acuerdo sobre el finiquito, que podría rondar los ocho millones de euros.
Benítez está sentenciado desde que el sábado, minutos después de ganar el Mundial de Clubs en Abu Dhabi, indignó a Moratti al quejarse de que éste no ha cumplido la promesa de ficharle a tres jugadores. No sólo eso: le instó hacerlo en enero o, en su defecto, seguir culpándole de los malos resultados en la Serie A y, en última instancia, "hablar con mi agente para buscar una solución".
"No he contactado con nadie"
Menos convincente fue otra de las declaraciones que realizó Moratti tras reunirse con Marco Branca, director del área técnica del Inter: "No he contactado con ningún otro entrenador". Pero al magnate le gustaría obtener el 'sí' del relevo para anunciar al mismo tiempo la destitución de Benítez y el nombre de su sustituto.
El primer favorito al cargo era Luciano Spalletti, pero esta opción quedó descartada al anunciar ayer Maxim Mitrofanov, director general del Zenit, que "él mismo nos ha dicho que quiere seguir otra temporada". En su primer año en el fútbol ruso, el técnico italiano, ex de Udinese y Roma entre otros, ganó primero la Copa en mayo y en noviembre completó el doblete conquistando la Liga.
"¿Leonardo? No bromeemos"
Descartado Spalletti, Leonardo aparece como el gran candidato a suceder a Benítez. "No bromeemos con esto", dijo ayer Moratti. Desde luego sería una decisión sorprendente ya que el brasileño, en su debut en los banquillos, fracasó la temporada en el Milan.
Además, su contratación avivaría la rivalidad entre los dos grandes rivales de la capital lombarda. El Milan contrató esta temporada al ex interista Zlatan Ibrahimovic, tras su paso por el Barça, y ahora le devolverían la monedaSigue en el Zenit y ahora Leonardo es el favorito para suceder a Benítez, cuya destitución depende del finiquito

description.hltext_display: Le Mondial des Bleus, flop de l'année sportive
description.author: Cyrille Haddouche
description.content:
Chronique d'une mort annoncée. Quand l'équipe de France va à vau-l'eau et boit le calice jusqu'à l'hallali. À la limite de l'hallucination collective, le psychodrame en mondovision qui s'est déroulé le 20 juin à Knysna restera dans les annalesde l'indécence. Jusqu'à révulserl'opinion publique française et alimenter les quolibets des médias internationaux. À l'image du Times de Londres qui s'était délecté de la faillite morale des Bleus en qualifiant la sélectionde Raymond Domenech de «pireéquipe nationale de tous les temps». En refusant de s'entraîner pour protester contre l'exclusion de Nicolas Anelka, pourtant coupable d'avoir vertement insulté le sélectionneur à la mi-temps de la défaite contre le Mexique, les joueurs français sont tout bonnement entrés en sédition contre leur fédération? Dans un décorum de prise d'otages, les «révoltés du Pezula ResortHotel & Spa» ont poussé le vice jusqu'à contraindre Domenech de relayer devant la presse leurs revendications intempestives. Au stade terminal? En affranchissant l'équipe de France et son sélectionneur de toute procédure de contrôle, de règle de conduite et d'obligation de résultat, le système fédéral porte une lourde responsabilité dans cet échec retentissant. France année zéro? Sommé de rendre des comptes devant les pouvoirs publics, Jean-Pierre Escalettes démissionna de la présidence de la FFF. S'il obligea l'institution à réformer sa gouvernance, le désastre de Knysna a surtout ouvert une crise profonde de leadership en son sein. Une période d'instabilité où l'unité est loin d'avoir été le maître mot. Des sanctions individualisées contre les joueurs jugés responsables de la fronde aux atermoiements sur la rétrocession de leurs primes (lire ci-contre) en passant par la préparation de l'assemblée fédérale de décembre où la modification de statuts de la FFF fut adoptée, chaque dossier a donné lieu à son lot de polémiques futiles et de coups bas en coulisses. Une ère de guerre larvée durant laquelle Laurent Blanc, le successeur de Domenech au poste de sélectionneur, a réussi à restaurer promptement l'image de l'équipe de France en dépit des divisions à la tête de la fédération. La seule satisfaction de l'annus horribilis des Bleus. Anelka, l'agent provocateur
Seul contre tous . S'il faut reconnaître une qualité à Nicolas Anelka, c'est l'obstination. À l'origine de la désintégration de l'équipe de France, l'attaquant de Chelsea assume son image d'insoumis. Dans une récente interview aux Inrockuptibles , Anelka raillait sa suspension de 18 matchs et persistait dans la provocation: «Si on m'avait demandé de chanter La Marseillaise, j'aurais refusé.» Nicolas Anelka, qui nie avoir proféré à l'encontre de Domenech les insultes rapportées par L'Équipe, alimente encore la polémique. (150.000 euros). «Ils n'ont pas refusé. On n'a pas clôturé le dossier. S'il reste un ou deux joueurs à contacter personnellement, je le ferai», a tenté de convaincre le président Duchaussoy. Selon Henri Émile, coordinateur sportif de la sélection, Henry attend de recevoir le document formalisant son renoncement pour le parapher. Anelka a indiqué qu'il n'avait pas été contacté par la FFF. Puis de préciser: «J'avais la volonté de signer ce document. Mais après cette nouvelle provocation de la Fédération, j'ai choisi d'adopter une attitude différente. Par conséquent et pour m'assurer de la véritable utilisation de la somme, j'ai décidé de la reverser moi-même à part égales vers le foot amateur, une association tournée vers les jeunes et une ?uvre sociale».

description.hltext_display: Telecom Italia's Franco Bernabe Elected as Chairman of GSMA
description.content:
The GSMA has elected Franco Bernabe, CEO of Telecom Italia, as its new Chairman for a two-year term, from January 2011 through December 2012. Jon Fredrik Baksaas, President and CEO, Telenor Group, was elected as Deputy Chairman. Rob Conway continues as CEO of GSMA.
In addition, 22 other people were elected to the GSMA Board.

description.hltext_display: Centroamérica dio 'un funesto paso atrás'
description.content:
Ulibarri puso el tema del conflicto a discusión. Archivo.
Nueva York/EFE.- El conflicto fronterizo que tiene nuestro país con Nicaragua fue tema de conversación durante en una reunión de la Asamblea General de la Organización de las Naciones Unidas dedicada, en un principio, a la comisión internacional contra la impunidad en Guatemala.
Eduardo Ulibarri, embajador tico, fue el primero en referirse a la disputa cuando señaló que todo Centroamérica ha dado “un funesto paso atrás” con la actuación “incomprensible” de Nicaragua en el río San Juan, que divide a los dos países.
“Padecemos, simple y llanamente, un hecho consumado por la fuerza. Si esta agresión no ha derivado en enfrentamientos armados es porque Costa Rica carece de ejército. Nuestra defensa no son las armas, sino el derecho; las razones, no las balas” , aseguró.
Asimismo, acusó al Gobierno nicaragüense de “fabricar una tosca justificación jurídica” para explicar la presencia de sus tropas en una zona del río San Juan que Costa Rica considera parte de su territorio.
Por su parte, el embajador nicaragüense Danilo Rosales, se excusó por tener que abordar este asunto en un foro originalmente dedicado a otro asunto.
Asimismo, rechazó las acusaciones de Ulibarri de que su país había invadido un territorio extranjero y aseguró que “ a los ojos de Nicaragua” sus soldados se encuentran en suelo de su país.

description.hltext_display: Where do governments fit into the new global economy?
description.author: Ron Ramsdale
description.content:
- Ron Ramsdale How the Commonwealth Development Bank helped build Australia
According to the currently fashionable view, in the short term governments are needed to deregulate their national economies but after that, they are to be consigned to the interchange bench and summoned only in emergencies.
Government involvement in the financial sector is a particular "no-no", with declamations of "funny money" and hyperinflation accompanying any proposal to give Australia's smaller producers access to funds at a more favourable rate than currently offered by the commercial lenders.
To point out that Germany's Kreditanstalt fur Wiederaufbau (Reconstruction Bank) has fulfilled this role for 50 years in the most inflation-conscious nation on earth is to invite the response that Australians and Germans are different!
But, as Ron Ramsdale* explains, an Australian version did exist - it was called the Commonwealth Development Bank and it helped hundreds of thousands of businesses across Australia.
*The late Ron Ramsdale, prior to his retirement, held the positions of State Manager, Western Australia and later Victoria, for the Commonwealth Development Bank of Australia.
Do we need to re-visit the recommendations of the Royal Commission appointed in 1935 to enquire into the Australian monetary and banking system and the Act of Parliament of 1959 establishing the Commonwealth Development Bank?
The Commission, inter alia, concluded that there was a distinct lack of facilities for fixed and long-term borrowing. This was of particular importance for rural borrowers. It was considered often difficult for a small farmer to obtain long-term credit on reasonable terms.
The man who was prepared to settle down on a small property, rear a family and by patient and diligent work gradually build up an equity in his own property, was a type of farmer who would strengthen the Australia rural system and should be encouraged.
In Australia, at the time leading up to the Royal Commission, it was not generally considered to be a function of the trading banks to lend long-term, although many of their overdraft advances against rural property did extend over lengthy periods and were, in effect, long-term loans. However, there was no fixed commitment as regards either the continuance of these advances or the rate of interest to be charged. Long-term lending in the past had been left to State Banks, Finance, Pastoral or Insurance Companies, or to private individuals.
The Royal Commission felt that there was a need in Australia's financial structure for a Mortgage Bank and in 1943 the Government acted on the Commission's recommendation and set up a Mortgage Bank Department of the Commonwealth Bank, designed to meet this need in the field of primary production. The new Department commenced business on September 27 of that year.
The Mortgage Bank Department lent only to persons engaged in primary production and against the security of rural land. Operations were conducted throughout the wide branch system of the Commonwealth Bank. The Department was able to make loans available at the lowest possible rate of interest, a fact which is of exceptional importance to primary producers. At the time, interest rates charged were 4% per annum for loans up to 20 years and 4.125% per annum for loans from 20 to 41 years. Interest was fixed for the full period of the loan.
Loans were made on first mortgage up to 70% of the Bank's valuation of the security, or £5000, whichever was the less. Principal was repayable with interest in equal half-yearly instalments throughout the period of the loan, with payment at expiry date of the balance, if any, then outstanding. A borrower had the option to repay any portion of the loan in an amount of not less than £10, and such repayment bore interest at the rate payable on the loan.
At the outset, the Department obtained the services of agricultural experts, who besides doing valuation work, made their knowledge and practical experience available to borrowers. Qualified young men from the universities and agricultural colleges were added to the staff from time to time. A valuation bureau was established for the purpose of maintaining a continuous investigation into rural land values in relation to productivity.
During the life of the Mortgage Bank Department, and because of its establishment, a high level of rural prosperity prevailed, and a considerable fall in the total of rural indebtedness occurred.
It was considered that the Mortgage Bank Department fulfilled the requirements it was designed to meet, and by reason of the advantageous terms it offered, provided a very beneficial competition. The small producer who obtained a mortgage loan from the Bank found a considerable part of his capital requirements on long and easy terms. He enjoyed a low and constant interest rate and was given security against the calling up of his loan or the possibility of having to make reductions at a time when he was least able to meet them.
Consequently, a borrower, given a reasonable run of seasons and prices, was enabled by hard work and perseverance, gradually to build up his equity and finally achieve the security of unencumbered ownership.
COMMONWEALTH DEVELOPMENT BANK OF AUSTRALIA
The Commonwealth Development Bank (CDB) was established under the Commonwealth Banks Act 1959 which also established the Reserve Bank and the Commonwealth Banking Corporation. In January 1960, the Commonwealth Development Bank took over the role of the Mortgage Bank and Industrial Finance Departments of what was then the former Commonwealth Bank.
The CDB was initially funded by a special capital injection of $1 million from the Federal Government. From that time onwards, its ongoing lending program was funded from retained profits, from term deposits raised from the public, and from the money market at favourable rates of interest obtainable because the bank was guaranteed by the Federal Government which had a AAA credit rating.
Under its charter, the CDB was required to provide loans to persons and business enterprises engaged in primary and secondary industry where, in the opinion of the Bank, such financial assistance resulted in an increase in productivity and was not otherwise available on suitable and reasonable terms.
Consequently, its role was to supplement other sources of finance and to follow a lending philosophy under which prospect of success, rather than value of security, was the primary consideration. As a supplementary lender, the CDB would not consider an approach until an applicant had first unsuccessfully discussed his requirements with, at least, his own trading banker.
As security was not the primary consideration in CDB's lending, the raw materials upon which the Bank worked were:
* The person - his integrity and his managerial capacity;
* His financial position - his assets, his liabilities (with their repayment implications) and his equity in his venture;
* His property - its inherent potential, its existing state of improvement and its past performance (if any); and
* His program - its technical feasibility, its productive potential and its economics.
In the assessment of lending proposals and in the absence of security being the prime consideration to a loan being approved, the CDB was staffed by highly experienced and competent lenders to assess the long-term viability of proposals.
To assist in this process, the staff included a range of specialists qualified in the areas of agricultural science, economics, management, accounting, and engineering. They spent much of their time in the field undertaking assessment and investigation work.
In determining the inherent prospects of a lending proposal, it was the practice of CDB to prepare budgets of estimated income and expenditure.
Frequently budgets were projected over a number of years, until the stage was reached where the full expected outcome of the development program was reflected in the projections of income and outgoings.
This budgeting process enabled the Bank to assess the ability of the applicant to repay his overall borrowings, including the proposed Development Bank loan.
In all cases, the term of the loan was based on the Bank's assessment of the ability of the applicant to repay without undue strain, with an appropriate principal repayment holiday being granted in particular circumstances.
Major impact
The CDB is no longer in existence, but during its first 30 years, it fulfilled a very meaningful role in the banking industry by helping almost 400,000 businesses.
In its formative years, the Development Bank was heavily involved financing individual farmers who took up holdings in the Ord River project, the Esperance Land Settlements Scheme in Western Australia, the Coleambally Irrigation Scheme in New South Wales, the Brigalow Scheme in Queensland and the Heytesbury Scheme in Victoria, to name a few.
In the opinion of the writer, the Commonwealth Development Bank played a most significant role during its lifetime in the development of rural and industrial undertakings and was the catalyst for the economic success of many individuals and entities who/which otherwise would have been denied the opportunity to have made a meaningful contribution to the Gross National Product and the nation's

event_or_fact.property: an Australian version did exist - it was called the Commonwealth Development Bank and it helped hundreds of thousands of businesses across Australia.*The late Ron Ramsdale, prior to his retirement, held the positions of State Manager, Western Australia an

description.hltext_display: City Council passes Budget
description.content:
Cork City Council has passed its budget for 2011.
At last nights meeting in city hall councillors voted 21 to 8 in favour of the plan.
City Manager Tim Lucey told the chamber that the ouncils income has dropped again, with Government funding alone down by over 8 percent, and that means cuts are necessary in all departments and services.
Commercial Rates however remain unchanged for the third year running
Refuse waivers will stay in place for low income households and old age pensioners as the Manager acknowledged it is important protect those struggling financially.
The Lord Mayors salary will not be slashed.
Councillors had been calling for a massive cut and for the savings to be put into traffic calming on the North side of the City.
Socialist party cllr mick barry said the salary level is unfair when everybody else is facing cuts.

description.hltext_display: Namibia: Nestor Tobias Laments Poor End to Good Year for Boxing
description.content:
BOXING promoter and trainer Nestor 'Sunshine' Tobias said recent infighting within the sport code's fraternity has dwarfed its success stories for the past year.
Speaking to The Namibian Sport yesterday, Tobias said it was damaging to the growth of boxing in the country if those appointed to help the sport don't have its best interest at heart.
Tobias, who received the WBO's award for the Best African promoter of the year, is adamant that continued bickering and "sabotaging" in local boxing circles will lead to its ultimate demise.
"The future of boxing is in our hands," said Tobias. "Those individuals who are supposed to help the sport but are only interested in themselves should go. My career is boxing and will protect and maintain it."
Despite the recent negative publicity that Namibian boxing has received, Tobias said he welcomed healthy competition as long as it was in keeping within the guidelines of the sport code.
"We need more boxers and promoters in order to develop the sport," he said. "We are not against anyone. I encourage anyone to get involved but just make sure you know the basics of the sport and that you have principles."
He further thanked his sponsors and the Namibian government for their support in making fights happen. Tobias said he hoped that more investors would enter the fray next year as the boxers need it in order achieve more on the international scene.
"These guys are putting the country on the map. They cannot do it without the support of the corporate world."
Four fighters from his stable will strive for international glory early next year. On January 21, Martin Haikali will defend his WBO Africa lightweight title in Ghana, with WBO Africa welterweight champion Tyson Uushona scheduled to fight Commonwealth title holder Denton Vassel in Bolton on February 26.
Flyweight boxer Abmerk Shidjuu is also set to challenge Chris Edwards on March 26 in Stoke for the Commonwealth title.
On the same day, WBO Africa light-heavy weight champion Vikapita Meroro will face Thomas Oosthuizen in South Africa for the WBC intercontinental belt.

description.hltext_display: Advice for coping with icy conditions (TA24)
description.content:
Once temperatures start to fall and there is the hazard of ice and snow on our roads, our driving skills are pushed to the limit.
So do you know how to drive properly in adverse conditions?
A few moments thought and some small preparations before setting out could save you from problems on the road. According to the Highways Agency even when drivers are aware that severe weather is expected, almost half of road users do not take proper precautions.
Despite severe weather warnings many will continue to make journeys which are not even necessary. The advice is STAY AT HOME unless you really do have to travel. You could delay your journey for a couple of hours until conditions improve and keep checking the latest forecasts from the Met Office.
If you do decide to travel, carry a winter weather kit consisting of a mobile phone, boots, blanket, spade, extra clothing, food and a hot drink. Make sure you de-mist and de-ice your car fully before starting off. Check your car has anti-freeze and lots of screen wash.
Once on the road, drive more slowly than usual and keep your distance from the vehicle in front. Be prepared to take more time than usual and let someone at your destination know that you have set off and your route and estimated time of arrival, so that they can alert the emergency services if you don't turn up.If you do get stuck, don't run your engine all the time and keep a window open a little bit for ventilation. Raise your feet off the floor to avoid cold spreading through your body.
Driving tips for bad weather:
Check both local and national weather forecasts.Only travel if absolutely essential. Take a bad weather kit with you.Keep your distance when following other vehicles.If you skid, ease off the accelerator, but do not brake suddenly.Brake gently, accelerate gently and turn the steering wheel gently.If climbing a slippery hill, use as high a gear as possible. Dazzle from low winter sun can be dangerous - carry a pair of sunglasses.Inform other people of your plans.
Heating appliances
The Fire Service is also warning people to take care when using extra real fuel' heating in the cold weather.
When using temporary heating appliances, ensure that materials which could catch fire are kept a safe distance (at least one metre) away.
The Fire Service advice is:
Before lighting the first fires of the season make sure chimneys are professionally cleaned and cleared of debris.Do not place logs next to woodburners for drying out as they will build up heat gradually and spontaneously combust.Store logs in a separate basket or stack well away from the fire.If you own a very old house make sure the plasterwork is kept in good order as exposed beams around the chimney area can easily catch fire. Thatched properties are vulnerable to fire so it is very important to make sure cleaning and maintenance is kept up to date and is regularly carried out.

description.hltext_display: Fitch потеряло всякую веру в Грецию
Intoxicados en hotel
description.content:
Angie López Arias
Una aparente intoxicación alimentaria en el Hotel Barceló Playa Tambor afectó a unas 100 personas que se encontraban hospedadas, confirmó María Luisa Ávila, Ministra de Salud.
Greivin Sandoval, subdirector del hotel, rechazó la versión y dijo que solo 22 personas se vieron afectadas no por una intoxicación alimentaria sino por excesos en comidas y bebidas.
Según Ávila, desde el lunes en la noche y la madrugada de ayer, los afectados sufrieron síntomas como vómito, diarrea, retorsijones y fiebre. Ante ello, una cantidad no precisada debió ser trasladada a la clínica de Paquera para su atención por el cuadro grave que presentaban, dijo Ávila.
En el centro de salud tomaron muestras de heces mientras que funcionarios del ministerio lo harán con alimentos para determinar que causó la intoxicación.
“Se tomó muestras y se determinó que no había nada que pudiera afectar al resto de la ocupación”, aseguró Sandoval.

นอกจากนี้ “ซัมซุง เวฟ ทู” ยังภูมิใจนำเสนอฟังก์ชัน HD Video Player & Recorder ที่จะนำทุกท่านสนุกสนานไปกับการรับชม หรือบันทึกไฟล์วีดีโอในรูปแบบ HD ในหลากหลายฟอร์แมต รวมทั้งฟังก์ชัน t9 Trace ที่จะทำให้คุณลืมการพิมพ์ข้อความแบบเดิมๆ ด้วยการพิมพ์ที่รวดเร็ว สะดวก และง่ายดายยิ่งขึ้น ทั้งหมดนี้มาในรูปแบบดีไซน์ที่สวยงามประทับใจเกินกว่าคำบรรยายด้วยสรีระบางเฉียบ สมกับเป็นนวัตกรรมล้ำสมัยในยุคดิจิตอลที่ควรค่าในการจับจอง
“ซัมซุง เวฟ ทู” เริ่มวางจำหน่ายเดือนมกราคม 2554 ในราคา 13,900 บาท พร้อม microSD การ์ด ความจุ 4 กิกะไบต์ ณ ร้านซัมซุงช็อปและร้านค้าตัวแทนจำหน่ายโทรศัพท์มือถือซัมซุงทั่วประเทศ สามารถสอบถามข้อมูลเพิ่มเติมได้ที่ศูนย์บริการลูกค้าซัมซุง 0-2689-3232 หรือโทรฟรีจากโทรศัพท์บ้าน 1-800-29-3232

description.hltext_display: Golf tip: Shorten your follow-through on putts
description.content:
When trying to hole short putts always putt with a positive stroke that accelerates through impact. Sometimes, however, it doesn't always go to plan with the short ones and, as I've seen many times in pro-ams and with my pupils, when a golfer tries too hard, he or she becomes tense and the putting stroke becomes undefined and wishy-washy.
Rather than accelerating positively towards the hole, the hands freeze, the putter decelerates through impact and the ball limply rolls off line. To hole more putts learn to make a more positive stroke.
I often read in instructional articles how golf pros advocate a stroke where the putter travels back and through the same distance - ideal in a perfect world. But this advice contains very little acceleration and the stroke can easily slip into a limp and weak effort where the putter head overtakes the hands. If you look at some of the great putters, who consistently hole out under pressure, there is a slight rapping tempo to the stroke, almost like a punch shot in golf.
This ensures that the hands are in control as the putter head accelerates into the ball. Study Tiger Woods (or Jack Nicklaus in his heyday) and one of the great pressure putters Ben Crenshaw. They all accelerate into the ball and have defined finish positions to their putting strokes.
If you are struggling on the greens and leave putts short, shorten the follow through to only two inches past the ball and putt with a 'rapping tempo' that encourages acceleration. Being able to curtail the follow through also means the hands are in control after impact and this helps keep the putter face squarer, longer.

description.hltext_display: US suits against Pakistani spy chief face hurdles
description.author: TOM HAYS
description.content:
NEW YORK -- The plaintiffs in two U.S. lawsuits accusing Pakistan's spy chief of nurturing terrorists involved in the 2008 Mumbai attacks are hoping for a historic outcome recalling the Lockerbie settlement, but they would have to overcome serious legal obstacles first, lawyers and experts say.
The civil complaints naming Gen. Ahmed Shuja Pasha and his Inter-Services Intelligence agency as defendants are like past lawsuits filed in federal courts against overseas figures with alleged links to terrorist attacks and other atrocities.
A lawyer for the U.S. plaintiffs, John Kreindler, said Tuesday that they hope to win a deal like the one struck with Libya over the 1988 bombing of Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbie, Scotland. The $1.5 billion settlement announced in 2008 was seen both as a victory for the families of 180 Americans killed in the terrorist attack and as a diplomatic breakthrough with the North African nation, once a pariah.
"The hope is to obtain appropriate compensation, but we also see it as a chance for the United States and Pakistan to join together and condemn terrorism," he said.
"I think our chances are very good," he added. "We wouldn't be doing it if it was simply for show."
But experts say a U.S. court could find that Pasha, as a high-ranking foreign official, is protected by sovereign immunity. Even when not protected, many international defendants don't bother to respond to summonses and, as a result, never see the inside of an American courthouse or engage in settlement negotiations.
Judges can hear testimony from the plaintiffs and order damages, but the chances of collecting are a long shot. In some cases, judges have tossed out cases after the U.S. government opposed them on diplomatic grounds.
"Lawsuits like this aren't highly successful," said John F. Murphy, a professor at Villanova University School of Law in suburban Philadelphia. "Decisions that have been favorable to the plaintiffs have been largely symbolic."
In Pakistan, prominent lawyer Athar Minallah said Tuesday that with the U.S. court's jurisdiction in question, he couldn't see the litigation getting very far.
"Why should they even bother to respond?" Minallah said of Pasha and the ISI.
An ISI representative said Tuesday that Pasha had received a summons but declined to discuss the case further.
The wrongful death lawsuits were filed last month in federal court in Brooklyn by relatives of victims in the Mumbai attacks, which left 166 people and nine attackers dead. The assault has been blamed on the Pakistani militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba, which is also named as a defendant.
The lawsuits repeat long-standing allegations that the ISI "has long nurtured and used international terrorist groups," including Lashkar.
"Defendant ISI provided critical planning, material support, control and coordination of the attacks" by a roving band of gunmen who attacked a Jewish community center, a popular restaurant and tourist hotels, the lawsuits allege.
The plaintiffs' lawyer has said they would not publicly discuss the case. They include the Brooklyn father of Gavriel Holtzberg, a rabbi who was killed along with his pregnant wife at the Jewish center, and the wife of Sandeep Jeswani, a Chicago man who was traveling on business when he was killed at a hotel.
The lawsuits, which seek unspecified damages, were filed under the Alien Tort Statute, an 18th century law that allows U.S. citizens to sue in U.S. courts for acts that violate international law. The law originally was enacted to prosecute pirates but has been used more recently by Holocaust survivors and relatives of people killed or tortured under despotic regimes.
In New York, lawsuits seeking billions of dollars in damages were filed by representatives, survivors and relatives of Sept. 11 victims against foreign governments, charities, financial institutions and individuals believed to have provided support to al-Qaida. The plaintiffs claim the defendants gave money to charities in order to funnel it to al-Qaida.
The cases are still pending but suffered a setback last year when the Supreme Court refused to allow claims against Saudi Arabia and four of its princes. The court left in place the ruling of a federal appeals court that the defendants are protected by sovereign immunity.
Other high-profile cases that were allowed to go forward have resulted in massive awards that remain unpaid.
In 2000, a federal judge in Manhattan ordered former Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic to pay $4.5 billion in damages for Serb atrocities in the 1992-1995 Bosnian war. The award came only weeks after another jury returned a $745 million verdict against Karadzic in another civil case in the same courthouse.
The plaintiffs had alleged gross human rights abuses, including genocide, torture, rape and execution in an ethnic cleansing campaign to drive non-Serbians from their homes in Bosnia-Herzegovina.
Karadzic fought the claims through New York lawyers for four years before telling the judge he would not defend himself. He never paid any damages and is currently fighting genocide charges at the U.N. war crimes tribunal in The Hague, Netherlands.
Karadzic had mocked the civil litigation, writing, "Do you really believe that attaching a U.S. dollar sign to human tragedy around the world by empty judgments in uncontested lawsuits is a step toward peace or justice?"
There was a similar outcome for a lawsuit against former Haitian paramilitary leader Emmanuel "Toto" Constant, who human rights groups say ordered the slaughter in the early 1990s of slum dwellers loyal to exiled President Jean-Bertrand Aristide.
In 2006, another Manhattan judge awarded $19 million to three Haitian women who claimed they were gang-raped by paramilitary soldiers under Constant's command. But Constant, who is now serving time in a New York state prison for mortgage fraud, never responded to the complaint, nor has he paid a dime in damages.
Still, the Center for Constitutional Rights, which sued on behalf of the women, considers the outcome a success, said Maria LaHood, a senior attorney for the human rights group.
LaHood said a main goal of such lawsuits is to hold the accused accountable by drawing attention to their crimes.
"It's primarily about justice for the victims, even if they're not going to be compensated in the end," she said.

description.hltext_display: Málaga, entre las ciudades más agraciadas por el Sorteo de Navidad
description.author: La Opinión de Málaga
description.content:
Sevilla y Cádiz son las ciudades andaluzas que más veces han sido favorecidas por el azar
VOTE ESTA NOTICIA
EUROPA PRESS Sevilla y Cádiz son las ciudades andaluzas que más veces han sido favorecidas por el Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad de la Lotería Nacional, ya que en ellas han recaído el 'Gordo' en 15 y 10 ocasiones en toda la historia del sorteo, según datos de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado consultados por Europa Press.
Madrid es la ciudad más afortunada, con un total de 72 'Gordos', seguida de Barcelona, con 37; Sevilla, con 15; Valencia (11), Bilbao (11), Cádiz (10) y Zaragoza (10). También han recibido la suerte de forma múltiple Santander en ocho ocasiones, Málaga, Alicante y Granada, en siete, y San Sebastián, en seis, Palma de Mallorca y Gijón en cinco, La Coruña y Vich (Barcelona), en cuatro y Badajoz, Burgos, Lugo, Sort (Lérida) y Pamplona en tres.
El 'Gordo' visitó en dos ocasiones Baeza (Jaén), Vitoria, Sabadell, Córdoba, Lérida, Álora (Málaga), Murcia, Palencia, Logroño, Segovia, Talavera de la Reina, Alcira y Manises (Valencia) y Valladolid.
De las grandes ciudades, sólo ha pasado una vez por Almería, Castellón, Ciudad Real, Cuenca, Guadalajara, Huesca, León, Oviedo, Pontevedra, Vigo, Las Palmas y Teruel, además de en otras localidades de menor tamaño.

description.hltext_display: Strumpfuskare stängs av
description.author: Tidningarnas Telegrambyr
description.content:
Taiwanesiskan Yang Shu-chun stängs av tre månader för att ha haft för många sensorer i strumporna under Asiatiska spelen. Tränaren får 20 månaders avstängning och Taiwans taekwondoförbund får böta motsvarande 341 000 kronor. (TT)
Internationella taekwondoförbundets hemsida attackerades av hackare som var upprörda efter att taiwanesiskan Yang Shu-chun straffats med avstängning efter att ha haft för många sensorer i strumporna under Asiatiska spelen. Yang diskvalificerades under tävlingarna och stängs nu av i tre månader. Hennes tränare fick 20 månaders avstängning och Taiwans taekwondoförbund får böta motsvarande 341 000 kronor.

description.hltext_display: ¡Astro impresionante!
description.content:
El único eclipse lunar del 2010 coincidió con el equinoccio de verano
Es la primera vez que la Luna se encuentra tan alta en el firmamento para este tipo de fenómeno. Rafael Pacheco.
Fabio Parreaguirre Gamboa
Quienes tomaron la decisión de quedarse bajo las cobijas la noche del lunes y la madrugada del martes, se perdieron del mejor espectáculo lunar de los últimos años, según los especialistas.
Así lo confirmó el físico y astrónomo José Alberto Villalobos. “Es el mejor eclipse lunar que he visto en mi vida, creo que la posición alta de la Luna y las condiciones del clima ayudaron mucho. Fue como ver estrellas en noche de Luna nueva, una experiencia increíble, porque se notaron todas las fases del eclipse”, indicó el especialista.
Según el José Alberto, no será sino hasta el año 2014 cuando los costarricenses podremos tener un espectáculo parecido.
“Quienes recuerdan el eclipse lunar de diciembre de 1991, luego del famoso solar, podrían compararlo con el de anoche (madrugada del martes), inclusive creo que en el año 2000 tuvimos uno de parecida magnitud”, explicó.
Las zonas altas de Cartago y Heredia, playas de Puntarenas y Guanacaste, fueron las privilegiadas y donde se vio de mejor manera el espectáculo lunar.
“Para quienes se pregunten el por qué del color rojo de la Luna, es por los gases que existen en nuestra atmósfera, al reflejar la luz solar contra la superficie lunar, esta se torna rojiza, es como el efecto de un amanecer o atardecer con los colores que se desprenden”, explicó Villalobos muy admirado por lo ocurrido.
Inclusive la misma NASA, indicó en su sitio web la magnitud de este evento, el cual fascinó a gran parte de la comunidad latinoamericana, principalmente a los argentinos y mexicanos, otros dos países donde se presenció con gran detalle el fenómeno.
Según la NASA, este eclipse lunar duró tres horas y 28 minutos. Para quienes no lo conocen, este tipo de fenómenos suceden cuando el Sol, la Tierra y la Luna forman una perfecta línea en el espacio, donde el satélite natural debe caer dentro del cono de sombra terrestre, lo que provoca la sombra rojiza que se notó anteanoche.
Para quienes quieren conocer más acerca de este eclipse lunar, pueden visitar la página creada por la NASA http://eclipse.gsfc.nasa.gov/lunar.html, ahí la astrónoma de este centro, la especialista Mitzi Adams le explica todo lo relacionado con este evento espacial.

description.hltext_display: Scientists produce first-ever, 100 times brighter rare colour of laser light
description.content:
Scientists at the department of energy's Thomas Jefferson National Accelerator Facility have produced a rare colour of laser light 100 times brighter than any other source, for the first time.
It is called vacuum ultraviolet and is in the form of 10 eV photons. "Using a hole out-coupling mirror on the Jefferson Lab Ultraviolet Demonstration FEL, we delivered vacuum ultraviolet harmonic light to a calibrated VUV photodiode and measured five nanojoules of fully coherent light in each micropulse," said George Neil, Jefferson Lab associate director for the FEL Division.
The find could outdo radiocarbon dating as a method of determining the age of materials. The 10 eV light could allow scientists to determine the age of materials between 100,000 to 1 million years, as compared to radiocarbon, which allows dating up to roughly 62,000 years.
It could contribute to ocean circulation models and maps of groundwater movement, as well as dating polar ice. "This new laser is also a perfect tool to study novel materials with great potential for addressing issues such as energy and the environment," said Gwyn Williams, FEL basic research programme manager. "We still have a lot of work ahead of us before experiments can begin. In the new year, we'll be working to deliver light into a lab for measurement and future experiments. We hope to accomplish those goals by March."

description.hltext_display: Dorftheater probt eifrig im Sennhof
description.content:
Wintersulger führen das Stück „Töchter zu verschenken“ auf
Salvatore Prodi, gespielt von David Lorenz (links) und Ulrich Straßburger in der Rolle des Pensionsbesitzers Leo Köberle bei den Proben des Wintersulger Dorftheaters im Heiligenberger Sennhof.
Heiligenberg (hoy) Eifrig proben die Mitglieder des Wintersulger Dorftheaters im Heiligenberger Sennhof. Das diesjährige Stück heißt „Töchter zu verschenken – Heiratskandidaten stürmen die Pension Köberle“. Das Stück stammt aus der Feder von Heidi Mager. Es sind nur noch wenige Tage bis zur Aufführung und bis dahin sollen Rollentext, Mimik und Gestik sitzen. Souffleur Georg Matt hilft auch bei den Proben auf die Sprünge, wenn es hakt. Regisseurin Margit Lorenz gibt sich erst zufrieden, wenn alles stimmt. „Uli, du musst einfach mehr in Rage kommen“, sagt sie. Oder: „Ist das geschickt mit dem Gepäck da vorne?“ Also wird das Gepäck anders platziert. Karin Maders Schlitz im Rock ist zu groß und die Szene mit dem Staubsauger sorgt für viel Gelächter. Aber trotz allem Spaß, den die Mitwirkenden haben, muss die Regisseurin doch fordern: „Die Szene machen wir noch mal, diesmal am Stück und ohne Lachen.“ Denn lachen sollen am Ende die Zuschauer und das werden sie ohne Ende, wie man das Dorftheater kennt. Alfons Felix, Armin Jäger und Manfred Fritz haben den Bühnenaufbau gemacht, denn nur bei einem guten Bühnenbild können die hektischen Ereignisse in der Pension realistisch dargestellt werden.
Bis zur Nachmittagsaufführung am zweiten Weihnachtsfeiertag um 14 Uhr im Sennhof ist nicht mehr viel Zeit. „Mäggi“ wird aber sich noch so manches Mal mit einem unüberhörbaren „Räuspern“ Gehör und Respekt verschaffen und den Laienspielern ihre Vorstellung vom Szenenablauf auf der Bühne erläutern.

description.hltext_display: Lure Records New Country Artist Release, JOSH HILLEY "The Sound...
description.content:
Lure Records is proud to release their new artist JOSH HILLEY on major country radio. Josh recently recorded his debut single ” The Sound Of Her Leaving” with multiple award-winning producers Ken Pearson and Todd Washburn. The song will be released nationally to compete with the major talent from Nashville and worldwide.
Josh Hilley is a new addition to the elite roster of the international, Country/Americana music label Lure Records, home of such legendary performers as Charlie Louvin, Van Howard, The Tennessee Three, Jack Green, and Ernie Ashworth. The award-winning and Hall of Fame executives at the helm of Lure Records, Todd Washburn and Ken Pearson, two names synonymous with music industry success, were immediately impressed with Josh’s capabilities as a songwriter. His demo EP recorded for the label eventually convinced the members of the “round table,” who then offered him a contract and a national promotion campaign.
Josh’s record label Lure Records was a Top-5 nominee for “True Country Label of the Year” by the Roots Music Association in 2008, along with Sony/BMG, MCA and Lost Highway. Lure artists have made it to commercial Country radio’s main Top 40 seven times in the past two years (five in the Top 20), and their expanding roster continues to succeed in competing with major label artists. “Though we are an indie label, we operate on the level of a major label and offer our artists the same avenues for success,” says Todd Washburn, owner of Washburn Mastering LLC. Todd, who recently produced an album of songs written mostly by four-time Emmy award-winning songwriter Gary Portnoy (“Cheers” TV theme), is also a well-known composer for film, Cable and Satellite TV. Ken Pearson, CEO of Bluesprings Music Group, is a renowned radio promotions executive, who works with many of the major record labels such as Universal/Disney, Mercury, Rounder, Lost Highway, Sugar Hill, Octone/BMG, Warner Brothers, Arista, TVT, Interscope and Octone. He was recently inducted into the Traditional Country Music Hall of Fame and the Alabama Music Hall of Fame.
Josh Hilley and his band “STR8T Shooters” will be following up the new single release for national radio with an extensive tour of the USA. His new EP was recorded in Tennessee, mixed and mastered in Virginia for Lure Records. Josh Recently opened for RCA Recording artist Jeff Bates. Bates released his debut album “Rainbow Man” in 2003, and is now signed with Black River Music Group.
Look for this new breakout artist for 2011 - Josh and his band STR8T Shooters!

description.hltext_display: Independent School District #256
description.content:
Red Wing, MN 55066
Red Wing, MN 55066
The Red Wing School Board held its monthly meeting on Monday, July 19, 2010 at the Red Wing City Council Chambers. The Board members, Superintendent Stan Slessor, Board Clerk/Director of Finance Brad Johnson, and members of the public and staff were present. Chairperson Heidi Jones called the meeting to order at 5:30 P.M.
Superintendent Slessor requested item 4.3 Resignation, Kai Coyle, be added to the agenda. Motion by Boldt, second by Christensen to approve the agenda as amended, motion carried 7-0.
Motion by O’Keefe, second by Kramp to approve the minutes, motion carried 7-0.
Chair Jones reported that the School Board information session will be at the Courtyard Café on Wednesday, July 21.
3.1 MCA Results/Adoption of Benchmarks: Dr. Kathy Radmer presented information on testing. Goals were established for growth for each year in order to reach proficiency by 2014, which is incorporated in the School Improvement Plan. Grades 3-7 registered gains, some significant in math. The District is very pleased with the first year of implementation in math. If a student failed the MDE test in the spring of the junior year, that student has one year to remediate in order to graduate. A waiver period has now been allowed, if remediation work is taken. Board Member Christensen asked if the District can be restrictive and was told that will be researched. Board Member Kramp asked how many students were in remediation now and was told only a handful. Reading scores were both up and down in elementary, but our overall growth exceeded the State average. Dr. Radmer further explained power benchmarks to be used in curriculum, which. includes offerings in enrichment. The next step in the benchmark process will be in September, to determine interventions for each piece. She explained how scores are analyzed to indicate students’ mastery and what specific things need to be done. If student has mastery, the system points towards enrichment. Board members asked a number of questions concerning how the process will work. Motion by Porter, second by Christensen to adopt the K-12 power benchmarks, motion carried 7-0.
3.2 Principal Retreat—School Improvement Priorities: Superintendent Slessor reported on the workshop covering efforts in the District for student improvement. Four areas of strategic focus were determined, encompassing items such as curriculum and how to connect it; student culture and behavior, behavior management, and character development. Which interventions are best practices to apply. A consistent evaluation program across the district was discussed. The District leadership team put together a timeline. Board members commented favorably on the energy and focus from the workshop.
3.3School Board Election Filing Information: Board Clerk Johnson reported that the filing period would be August 3-17 at the District office, with a fee of $2. We have no primary and all candidates will be on the General Election ballot on November 2.
4.1Claims & Accounts
June 1-15, 201
Fund 01-General Funds$1,133,264.99
Fund 02-Food Service 13,442.08
Fund 03-Transportation 206,887.86
Fund 04-Community Services 11,143.20
Fund 05-Capital Expenditures 10,321.70
Fund 06-Building Construction 0.00
Fund 07-Debt Service 0.00
Fund 08-Auxiliary 15,109.69
Fund 09-Trust Agency 106.53
Fund 21-Student Activities 3,973.78
Fund 50-Student Activities 3,463.22
Total$1,397,713.05
Payroll—June 15, 2010$1,441,203.59
4.2New Hire: Betsy Ulvenes, 1.0 FTE DCD/MM Teacher at Burnside Elementary, effective August 30, 2010 (replacement for a transfer); Ashley Greenfield, 0.5 FTE Phy Ed Teacher at RWHS, effective August 27, 2010 (new position for inclusion of 8th grade to high school); Courtney Snyder, 5th Grade Teacher at Twin Bluff Middle School, effective August 2010 (replacement for a resignation). instructor/Lifeguard at Twin Bluff Middle School, effective February 19, 2010;
4.3 Resignation: Katie Koxlien, ECSE Teacher at Sunnyside Elementary School, effective June 30, 2010; Kai Coyle, Teacher at Riverbend Montessori School, effective July 19, 2010.
4.4Termination: William Black, Social Worker, Social Worker at RWHS, effective July 1, 2010.
Superintendent Slessor stated that recommendations for Condition of Employment salary increases were included in the Consent Agenda packet, and were generally 2.25%. Board member Christensen questioned the amount. Motion by Christensen, second by Porter to approve the Consent Agenda; motion carried 7-0.
There was no unfinished business
6.1Health and Safety Report: Building & Grounds Director Kevin Johnson summarized his annual health and safety report for the Board. There is a new format due to changes in personnel at the State. Explained safety issues, including mode rate (dropped from 1.20 to 1.17). He detailed the contacts for various requirements and explained how the safety committee works. The fire marshal and department of health both conduct inspections. Motion by Christensen, second by Boldt to adopt the Health & Safety report, motion carried 7-0. Board member O’Keefe thanked to Kevin for good work.
6.2Approval of High School Handbook: Superintendent Slessor stated that a question was raised on weighted grading, and it has been decided to use it throughout the system, including the honor roll. Motion by Christensen, second by Kramp to adopt the handbook; motion carried 7-0.
6.3Adoption of Official 2009-10 Calendar Due to Snow Days: The Board has to meet the legal requirement to adopt the actual calendar at the end of the year. Due to snow days, the actual school year was 173 days. Motion by Kramp, second by Porter to approve the amended 2009-10 calendar, motion carried 7-0.
Chair Jones mentioned upcoming Board meetings, not workshops, on August 2 and August 16. The first day of school will be September 7. The District Candidate information night will be July 21. Motion by Boldt, second by Kramp to adjourn, motion carried 7-0. Chair Jones adjourned the meeting at 6:57 pm.
Respectfully Submitted,
Brad Johnson
Board Clerk
(Dec. 22)
Tags: public notices, general legals

description.hltext_display: 500.000 clientes se quedaron sin servicio
description.content:
A quienes llamaban a los celulares con problemas, el sistema les daba “Falla de conexión” o sonaba ocupado. Archivo.
Fabio Parreaguirre Gamboa
Comparta
Ayer los usuarios de la vieja tecnología celular TDMA y que se modernizaron por un “3G”, con el prefijo 83, tuvieron problemas desde las 12 medio día hasta las 4 de tarde, informó el Instituto Costarricense de Electricidad.
“Estimamos que cerca de 500 mil clientes tuvieron inconvenientes, principalmente en la salida y entrada de llamadas”, indicó Elberth Durán vocero del ICE.
Según Durán, esta plataforma la administra la empresa China Huawei, “ya fue enviado un informe a la Sutel respecto al tema”.
“El servicio se vio interrumpido hasta las 4 de la tarde, ya a partir de esa hora se normalizó”, indicó el vocero.
A su vez, reconoció que este problema no tiene nada que ver con el producido en las líneas GSM el sábado anterior, ya que esta plataforma la administra la empresa Ericsson.
Publicidad
Publicidad

description.hltext_display: Autos burglarized, interiors burned
description.content:
By KATLYNN LANHAM The Facts | 0 comments
CLUTE — Police are searching for the person who burglarized three vehicles and burned the interiors of two after video surveillance possibly caught the culprit’s image.
A 50-year-old Houston man reported finding his Chevrolet Silverado pickup broken into with his GPS missing and a burned interior about 6 a.m. Monday in the 1000 block of Highway 332, Officer Belinda Rickman said. Police responded to a similar call 30 minutes later at a business in the 700 block of Wade Street, she said.

description.hltext_display: Paramedics' Facebook pranks spark investigation
description.author: Charlie Mole
description.content:
Banstead-based paramedics who were caught fooling around on Facebook have been reminded by bosses to “act professionally”.
South East Coast Ambulance Trust staff were filmed in chairs doing a conga, sleeping at desks and pulling funny faces for pictures posted on the social networking site.
Joke photos at the trust’s HQ in Banstead, which were exposed by the Sun newspaper, include NHS emergency staff and 999 operators.
A spokesman for South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Trust said an investigation had been launched.
He said: "We are currently looking into this matter to establish the circumstances surrounding the creation of the images and therefore are unable to comment further on this case.
"However, the trust takes any breach of its policies and procedures very seriously and will be issuing a reminder to all staff on their duty to act professionally while at work and also on the appropriate use of social networking sites."

description.hltext_display: Bamburullstolar till japanskt flyg
description.content:
Japan Airlines (JAL) har kommit på ett sätt för rullstolsburna flygpassagerare att slippa tidsödande extrakontroller - rullstolar av bambu.
"Med en rullstol i bambu kan fysiskt utsatta passagerare färdas snabbt till gaten, de förblir sittande genom säkerhetskontrollen", heter det i ett pressmeddelande från JAL.
De sofistikerade fordonen går loss på 600 000 yen (50 000 kronor) styck, och införs på japanska flygplatser under 2011.

description.hltext_display: Firebird hood - improve the looks and the performance
description.content: When the name of a car speaks of passion and freedom as does the name of Firebird then as an owner you must feel like a car enthusiast who looks for more than a transportation solution to go from one place to another. You want a car that makes a style statement, carries you in comfort and delivers a performance that is lively and yet with control and grace. And though the stock car goes a long way towards doing that for true freedom andpassion you must add a personal touch. And you will find there are quite a few ways to add a personal touch to your car. If you are pressed for time you could do it with a simple modification that has enough impact to make your car look distinctive. But if you do have the time you can make an informed choice and improve the looks of the car, improves its performance and add a personal touch to it. If you go in for a carbon fiber hood it may not be apparent but you get several benefits by opting for a product that does not cost a lot. A carbon fiber hood is a great way to make a style statement in a highly visible manner right at the front of the car. And you can make your car look as personal as you want thanks to that. But the carbon fiber hood does much more. It will help you keep the engine compartment cooler which will improve the engine performance. It will also help you reduce the weight of your car which will help its performance to become more lively. And since this weight reduction is at the front of the car it will become easier to steer and control the car since the front wheel will have less weight to carry. You can choose a Firbird hood for your car conveniently by going online. You can check out the graphic options as well to spot something that reflects your attitude and style. You can also make a comparison of the prices on offer. You can see the latest Firebird hoods at www.ilovebodykits.com.

description.hltext_display: 'Una situación inexplicable'
description.author: La Opinión de Málaga
description.content:
'GATO' ROMERO El Málaga tiene una situación difícil de explicar. No es que me sorprendiera el resultado ante el Atlético porque el equipo no viene haciendo partidos buenos. Pero fue una derrota contundente. Lo que pasa que en estos momentos, cualquier derrota que tenemos ya parece un golpe fuerte. Hay que ser sensatos y pensar que hay que ganar los partidos de casa como sea. No se ha podido levantar cabeza y se nota que algunos futbolistas que no ven tampoco salida a la situación en la que está el equipo.
La afición está en todo su derecho de reclamar y exigir a la plantilla un buen rendimiento. Pero todos los malaguistas tenemos que ser pacientes porque esto no va a ayudar al equipo. En nuestra ciudad y en nuestro campo hay que demostrar que los aficionados seguimos defendiendo los colores del Málaga pese a que los resultados no acompañan. El año pasado la situación era diferente. El equipo daba la sensación de que en cualquier momento podría salir de abajo, pero ahora las sensaciones no son las mismas. Y sólo con un golpe de timón se cambiaría la situación. Espero que este parón sirva para que los jugadores se relajen y se centren y que regresen con las pilas renovadas.
Más allá de todo lo negativo tenemos que pensar en cosas positivas para el Málaga. Hay que contar ahora con el mercado de invierno para intentar revertir la situación que está viviendo el club. Yo lo veo como la única solución. El equipo está en una dinámica que no levanta cabeza y creo que va a hacer falta futbolistas que vengan con frescura al equipo y muy motivados para afrontar la situación de la zona baja en la que está el Málaga. Sin duda está haciendo falta en la posición de mediocentro un par de futbolistas y después, lo que el entrenador entienda que le hace falta al equipo. No hay que buscar culpables y sí soluciones. Pero sobre todo, es evidente que necesita un mediocentro defensivo. Desde la salida de Toribio no hemos encontrado a nadie en esa posición que dé un buen rendimiento y que dé equilibrio al equipo.
Por último, me gustaría también invitar a todos los aficionados del Málaga que si quieren ver a las viejas glorias malaguistas tienen una bonita oportunidad para seguirlas en la Liga Indor que comenzará el día 21 de enero en Madrid contra el Atlético. En el equipo en el que yo formo parte nos hemos reunido jugadores de la talla de Valcarce, Manu Sánchez, Sandro, Emilio Pérez, Salguero, Basti, Rafa Morales o Iznata, entre otros. Tenemos puesta mucha ilusión en este torneo ya que para nosotros es otra oportunidad de volver a los campos, aunque sean más pequeños. Esperemos que podamos darle un buen lugar al Málaga en el torneo.

description.hltext_display: Vieron la final
description.content:
Estos personeros de la Junta de Protección Social no se perdieron la final del Campeonato Nacional. El atraso en la devolución de enteros del “Gordo” por parte de los vendedores, fue lo que les permitió observar el encuentro del domingo entre la Liga Deportiva Alajuelense y el Club Sport Herediano.
En casa de Mickey Mouse
Después de la cobertura de la final, el periodista de Teletica Deportes, Maynor Solano, preparó sus maletas para ir a vacacionar a Orlando en Estados Unidos. El comunicador manifestó en su Facebook que “llegó el momento de ser niños otra vez”. Esperamos que disfrute bastante sus vacaciones.
Chinchilla se tiró a la cancha
Siguiendo con la final, la presidenta de la República, Laura Chinchilla, fue la homenajeada del importante encuentro. En la gramilla del Morera Soto se le vio muy risueña durante el momento de lanzar el balón. Después se retiró a disfrutar del partido como una aficionada más en el palco donde se encontraba el director técnico de la Selección Nacional, Ricardo La Volpe.

description.hltext_display: Alkoholkontrollen an den Weihnachtstagen in NRW
description.content: Die Polizei hat für die Weihnachtstage verstärkt Alkoholkontrollen bei Autofahrern in Nordrhein-Westfalen angekündigt. «Wer sich alkoholisiert ans Steuer setzt, muss mit empfindlichen Strafen rechnen», sagte Innenminister Ralf Jäger (SPD) am Mittwoch in Düsseldorf.

description.hltext_display: Unfälle im Schnee
description.content:
Roth (HK) In Belmbrach ist am Montagvormittag eine 52-jährige Rotherin auf schneeglatter Fahrbahn mit ihrem Auto ins Schlingern geraten. Sie kam von der Fahrbahn ab und überrollte einen Leitpfosten. Ihr Toyota kam im Straßengraben zum Stehen und blieb im Schnee stecken. Ein Abschleppfahrzeug musste das Auto wieder auf die Straße ziehen. Die Frau konnte ihre Fahrt fortsetzen.
Ein weiterer schneebedingter Unfall ereignete sich am Nachmittag. Ein 48-Jähriger Lastwagenfahrer fuhr auf der Walpersdorfer Straße in Richtung Ortsmitte. Auf der durch angehäufte Schneemassen verengten Fahrbahn sah er auf Höhe Einmündung Bahnweg ein Auto entgegenkommen. Sein Versuch, den Laster auf der schneeglatten Fahrbahn abzubremsen, scheiterte – der Laster rutschte nach links und prallte gegen das Auto einer 59-Jährigen, die sich durch den Anprall des Lastwagens leichtere Verletzungen zuzog.
Hilpoltsteiner Kurier

description.hltext_display: Toyota unveils new Vitz with best-in-class mileage
description.content:
Toyota Motor Corp unveiled on Wednesday the third-generation Vitz hatchback, its top-selling gasoline car in Japan, saying the subcompact gets best-in-class mileage of 26.5 km/litre.
The Vitz competes with segment leader Honda Motor Co's Fit and Nissan Motor Co's March, and sold about 125,000 units in Japan in the business year that ended in March 2010.
Its fuel economy, measured under Japanese test methods, beats the March's 26.0 km/litre and the Fit's 24.5 km/l, Toyota said.
Toyota set a monthly sales target of 10,000 Vitz cars in Japan. Pricing starts at 1.06 million yen ($12,660).
A day earlier, the world's biggest automaker forecast its sales in Japan to fall 17% to a 37-year-low of 1.3 million units in 2011, worse than a 9.9% drop predicted for the overall market by the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association.
Government subsidies favouring gasoline-electric and other advanced vehicles had fuelled sales of Toyota's Prius hybrid to record levels until the stimulus expired in early September. Toyota's domestic sales fell 35% in November from a year earlier, faring worse than most other brands, although a separate incentive exempting hybrids from some taxes will run until early 2012.
Cumulative sales of the Vitz, called the Yaris in some markets, have exceeded 3.5 million units in more than 70 countries since the first-generation version was launched in 1999.

description.hltext_display: Easy Veggie Meal Plans Review - A Vegetarian Diet Plan For Weight Loss
description.content:
In this Easy Veggie Meal Plans review I am going to cover what this vegetarian diet solution is, whether it works and what it can do for you as a fat loss guide.
What Is Easy Veggie Meal Plans?
It's a diet book created by Kardena Pauza who is a professional nutritionist and fitness expert. In his guide not only does he expose many truths about the true quality of meat in our diets but also debunks a number of ill-conceived myths and sets you straight on the truth behind vegetarian meals and diets.
Who Should Follow This Guide?
Anyone that wants to follow exciting recipes to create vegetarian dishes that are not only healthy, but also contribute towards your fat loss goals. You won't need to shell out a fortune on ingredients and most of them will probably already be present somewhere in your kitchen including inexpensive fruits and vegetables. The Easy Veggie Meal Plans guide contains a variety of different recipes that are straight forward to follow and prepare. These are exciting and interesting dishes that will keep you motivated to follow your diet plan.
What Does The Program Contain?
Easy Veggie Meal Plans includes the fully downloadable meal plans guide and more bonuses to help you get the most out of your vegetarian diet. In addition to the main guide you also get a vegetarian lifestyle book, quick start coaching call, a defend your diet coaching call and a smoothies bonus which includes eight of the best recipes for high energy levels that will pick you up and make you feel good. This is a diet plan that people should follow if they really want to lose weight and make the necessary changes to their lifestyle to facilitate this. Easy Veggie Meal Plans Review - Final Verdict
This guide not only serves as a superb introduction to following a vegetarian diet, it also shows you how you can lose weight and burn fat for a slimmer and healthier you. It's not an overnight fix or a short term fad diet for burning off body fat. Instead it is ideally suited to dieters that genuinely want to lose weight as part of their lifestyle. The additional bonus books and coaching calls make this a very attractive proposition for anyone that wants to lose weight and follow a vegetarian diet without having to spend a fortune on foods to achieve their goals.

description.hltext_display: Biggest storm yet heads for Calif; homes evacuated
description.author: GILLIAN FLACCUS
description.content:
LOS ANGELES -- After days of relentless rain, Southern California is awaiting the most intense storm system yet, with evacuations ordered, rescue crews on standby and residents anxiously eyeing already saturated mountainsides denuded by wildfires.
Forecasters expected more rain across the state Wednesday, but the focus clearly was on Southern California where a monster storm was expected to bring torrential rain, thunderstorms, flooding, hail and possible tornadoes and water spouts. Forecasters warned of possible rainfall rates of .75 inch to 1 inch an hour and thunderstorm rates of 2 inches an hour in the region.
Steady rain began falling late Tuesday and was expected to intensify into early Wednesday.
"It's going to be a three-ring circus," said National Weather Service spokesman Bill Hoffer. "There's going to be a six-hour time frame in the early morning when it's really going to be dumping on us."
Officials on Tuesday ordered evacuation of 232 homes in La Canada Flintridge and La Crescenta, foothill suburbs of Los Angeles below steep hillsides that burned in 2009 and where mudslides inundated homes and backyards in February.
Walt Kalepsch said his backyard filled up with mud and debris last winter, but he planned to stay the night with his wife and daughter.
"If it gets really terrible, we'll leave. But we've been evacuated so many times, it's like the city's crying wolf," he said. "During the rest of the year, it's absolutely gorgeous. It was just one big wildfire that changed everything."
As the "Pineapple Express" system swept Pacific Ocean moisture across Nevada, Arizona and Utah, Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger declared a state of emergency in six counties.
The huge and powerful low pressure system off the West Coast pushed precipitation right into the Great Basin.
"It takes a lot of energy to push that moisture over the mountains," said NWS meteorologist Dave Bruno. "This kind of storm could march right across the country and create a lot of bad weather along the way. It could affect the Southern Plains on Thursday and Friday. If it sticks together it'll hit Florida by Saturday."
With rain falling up and down the state, Sierra Nevada ski resorts boasted of record-breaking December snowfall, with the storms bringing a total of 10 1/2 to 15 1/2 feet to Mammoth Mountain.
Rescuers had to pluck some stranded motorists from rain-swollen creeks. Shoppers dodged puddles while buying last-minute Christmas gifts. Disney resorts canceled a plan to shower visitors with artificial snow.
In Orange County, four hikers missing overnight in a flooded canyon in the Cleveland National Forest were rescued Tuesday morning by helicopter after their car was trapped along swollen Trabuco Creek. Rescuers used a bulldozer to retrieve five other people who became stranded by the creek.
Downtown Los Angeles received more than a third of its annual average rainfall in less than a week.
Parts of the San Gabriel Mountains got more than 18 inches of rain since Friday, with coastal cities like Santa Monica and Long Beach getting more than six inches, the National Weather Service said.
Mudslides are a significant risk for three years after a fire and are especially likely anytime the rainfall rate reaches or exceeds one inch per hour, said Susan Cannon, a research geologist with the U.S. Geological Survey.
That's a likely scenario Wednesday in the area burned by last year's Station Fire, which charred 250 square miles above the suburbs tucked below the San Gabriel Mountains.
"It means that once the heaviest rains start, it should be a very active time up there," Cannon said.
For all the perils of the torrential rains, there was a silver lining: The water is expected to help ease the effects of years of drought. Thursday is expected to be dry, with sunshine. There will be light rain on Christmas Day in parts of California.
Water content in the snow pack in California's mountains was at 197 percent of normal and 169 percent of the average measurement for April 1 - traditionally the date when the snow's water content is at its peak, said Ted Thomas, spokesman for the California Department of Water Resources.
As the snow melts, that water will run off into reservoirs that feed the state's extensive agriculture and city water systems.
