description.hltext_display: Aumentan vendedores ambulantes
description.content:
Por semana se realizan entre 200 y 250 decomisos de mercadería
El número de comerciantes callejeros aumenta en estos días. Muchas personas aprovechan para comprar artículos. Archivo.
Angie López Arias
Los comerciantes ambulantes en el centro de San José aumentan en estos días de auge comercial por lo que la Policía Municipal reforzará algunos operativos.
Y es que además de los vendedores tradicionales, en estos días se suman a la actividad personas que aprovechan sus vacaciones para hacer negocio.
Marcelo Solano, coordinador general de seguridad ciudadana y Policía Municipal de San José, indicó que la cantidad de comerciantes pasa de 1.500 a más de 2.500.
“Oscila mucho, depende de las actividades, por ejemplo para el Festival de la Luz había más de tres mil vendedores, el movimiento cayó y vuelve a repuntar hasta el 24 de diciembre”, dijo.
Ante ello, los policías municipales refuerzan acciones de control y se ubican en bulevares, zonas aledañas a paradas de buses y vías como la Avenida Segunda.
“Hay oficiales a pie y en moto que se ubican en áreas prioritarias. En diciembre la instrucción es decomisar la mercadería que esté en el calle”, aseveró Solano.
En promedio se realizan alrededor de 250 requisas por semana, la mayoría se trata de productos perecederos y cds pirateados. Lo incautado se destruye y en el caso de los discos se incineran.
Cuando se trata de ropa, luces de navidad y guantes, entre otros, se traslada al vendedor al Juzgado en donde se le impone una multa para recuperar la mercancía.
Solano manifestó que los decomisos no producen gran impacto en la calle, pues existe una compleja organización de comerciantes ambulantes en San José.
En otras provincias, como Heredia, el fenómeno no es igual. Francisco Rivera, jefe de la Policía local, comentó que allí las ventas informales están muy controladas. “Se dan casos aislados. Cuando se hacen operativos fuertes en San José se da migración pero muy poco, esto lo tenemos muy bien vigilado”, afirmó.

description.hltext_display: Martha J. Marsh Logan, 73
description.content:
in Angola, the daughter of Wade and Nellie (Simmons) Shumaker. She moved to the Muncie area with her family and graduated from DeSoto High School in 1955.
Martha was employed at Jo-Ann Fabrics and Crafts, where she taught quilting for twenty years prior to her retirement.
She enjoyed playing the piano, collecting old sheet music, knitting, crocheting and quilting.
Martha was a member of College Avenue United Methodist Church and the Night and Morning Quilt Guild.
Surviving are her husband, John D. Logan; her daughter, Amy Sue Myers (husband, Dan), North Manchester; two sons, James Richard Marsh (wife, Marcella), Indianapolis, and Jonathan Andrew Marsh (wife, Anita), Anderson; four step-children, Paula Schultz (husband, Earl), Phoenix, Arizona, Pam Butler (husband, Jerry), Greenwood, Mark Logan (wife, Janet), Beech Grove, John R. Logan, Phoenix, Arizona; four grandchildren; and her brother, John Shumaker, Indianapolis.
She was preceded in death by her first husband, James Marsh, and her brother, James Shumaker.
Memorial services will be 2:00 p.m. Thursday at Parson Mortuary with Pastor Chip Gast officiating.
The family will receive friends from noon until service time at 2:00 p.m. at the mortuary on Thursday.
Memorials may be sent to Cancer Services of East Central Indiana, Little Red Door.
Online condolences may be sent to http://www.parsonmortuary.com.

description.hltext_display: Los bombos de la Lotería de la Navidad empiezan a repartir ilusión
description.author: La Opinión de Málaga
description.content:
El Sorteo Extraordinario de la Lotería de Navidad ha comenzado en el salón de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado, donde los niños del Colegio San Ildefonso ya cantan los números
VOTE ESTA NOTICIA
Lotería de Navidad: Pedrea | Sorteo | Historia | Comenta el sorteo | Lotería del Niño | Widget de la Lotería de Navidad
EP / MADRID El Sorteo Extraordinario de la Lotería de Navidad ha comenzado en el salón de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado, donde los niños del Colegio San Ildefonso ya cantan los números.
El nuevo salón de sorteos de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado (LAE) en el Palacio de Congresos se ha abierto alrededor de las 08:00 horas de la mañana para permitir la entrada a los espectadores y aproximadamente una hora más tarde comenzará el sorteo de Lotería de Navidad con la extracción de las bolas de los número y los premios por parte de los niños del Colegio San Ildefonso.
Previamente, anoche se hizo público el examen y recuento de las bolas de los números y premios, que pudieron ser comprobadas por los asistentes que lo desearon, previa petición y autorización del presidente. Finalizada la operación de recuento, se desalojó el salón y se aseguraron con cerrojos interiores todos sus accesos, a excepción de la puerta del estrado, cuyas llaves quedan en poder de tres diferentes claveros.
A las ocho de la mañana, se ha formado la primera mesa que supervisará el llenado de los bombos con las bolas ya colgadas de las liras y el protocolo durante el que el público en general ha podido, desde ese momento y antes de que comience el sorteo, comprobar que la bolita del número que juega está entre las 85.000 que entrarán en el bombo de los números.
Esta operación se efectúa tanto con las bolas de números como con las de premios. Por último, los bombos son cerrados y a una señal del presidente se voltean simultáneamente. Un niño o niña del colegio de San Ildefonso extrae una bola del bombo de números y otro niño, a la vez, otra del de premios, con lo que comienza el sorteo, en torno a las nueve de la mañana.
Al finalizar el sorteo de Navidad, cuando en el bombo de premios no queda ninguna bola, un equipo de más de cuarenta personas se encarga de realizar la lista de premios del sorteo y de las poblaciones agraciadas con los premios mediante un proceso informático controlado en todos sus extremos.
De esta forma, aproximadamente a los 45 minutos de terminado el sorteo, y después de haber pasado por varias comprobaciones y punteos, está preparada la cinta y lista de premios para su entrega a la Fábrica Nacional de Moneda y Timbre, encargada de imprimir la lista oficial de premios. Dicha lista se edita y distribuye la misma tarde del día del sorteo a las Administraciones de Loterías y a los medios de comunicación.
Las tablas de los números premiados, quedan expuestas siete días al público. Transcurrido este tiempo son abiertas y las bolas contadas y examinadas nuevamente, para cualquier otro sorteo posterior a celebrar por este sistema.

description.hltext_display: Richard Morning Star: Russia should be U.S. ally in energy area
description.content:
U.S. Department of State Special Envoy for Eurasian Energy Richard Morningstar has given an interview to Interfax in which he speaks about U.S.-Russian relations in the energy sphere.
Question: You have just visited Moscow and taken part in the Joint US-Russian Commission on energy issues established by the presidents. Do you see this as something that gives any results, or it’s a purely bureaucratic exercise? Do you see any achievements?
Answer: First of all, the working group has been very viable and important communication in actual work in any number of areas where we have not been working prior. The Department of Energy is responsible for areas like energy efficiency, new technologies. They have made very specific progress with their Russian counterparts. We had very good discussions with our contacts and Minister Shmatko. The work that I have been involved in has been in connection with energy security subworking group. And we also made considerable progress.
One of the areas we talked of is what is happening on energy markets, and what changes are taking place. All over the world energy is becoming more competitive. It is important that all countries diversify and that includes Russia diversifying into Asia countries like China and South Korea that are growing markets. We were talking about investment. We hope that we will have an investment conference later this spring in Moscow. This is something that was agreed at energy working group meeting back in June between Secretary Chu and Minister Shmatko. And we think there are some real opportunities relating to investment in Russia in the energy area, as well as Russian investments in the United States. I think it’s a two way street. While in Moscow I spoke not only with Minister Shmatko, Deputy Minister Denisov, but also think-tanks and investment firms. Two funds that are very active in energy area.
I think it’s an opportunity to work in areas in Russia’s interest with respect to investments. We talked about what some of those areas may be. Looking at areas that Russia feels in its interest we could also look at some regulatory issues that are of concerns like taxation.
I want to emphasize that it’s a two way street for both U.S investments in Russia and Russian investments in the U.S. We had very important discussions about various projects. Given the changes in the global energy markets, the financial crisis it is very important that we have these conversations, that we understand exactly what our Russian colleagues think and our Russian colleagues understand what we are thinking. And if we do that I think in overtime we may come to constructive win-win solutions that are in everybody‘s interest. We don’t want to play a zero-sum game.
Q.: How do you evaluate, how does the U.S. Government evaluate Russia at the global energy market? Is it an ally of the United States? Is it a neutral player? Or is it an enemy of the United States?
A.: I think Russia should be an ally of the United States in the energy area. Russia will continue as long as we can foresee to be a major player in the energy market. And that is why it is so important to do what we are now doing to constructively engage Russia. We may have differences in various times, but if we talk openly about whatever differences there may be and continue to work in areas where we can agree than we can make a lot of progress. But its not an overnight process. I think we are talking about making progress in next couple of years.
Q.: How do you estimate the demand for the Russian natural gas in the United States?
A.: We have to see how that develops. Few years ago everybody would thought that there would be a significant demand for Russian liquefied natural gas, but because of the development of the shale gas over the last couple of years we are not importing even as much LNG. If shale continues to be the major part of our energy structure it maybe that frankly that there will be less demand. And it has nothing to do with Russia.
Q.: It seems that in Russia the issues of shale gas has not been taken very seriously. Do you view shale gas as a serious source of energy in the future?
A.: Sure! The question is how much. Obviously it has been an important factor in the United States. European countries are looking closely at it too. There are a lot of unanswered questions with the respect to environmental issues: how much shale gas there actually is, what the expense would be. All of these are important issues, but our feeling is that is something that should be pursued is being pursued by countries like Poland and Ukraine. Possibly, other countries. Our advice for it worth to those countries is "yes, they ought to pursue shale." But it should be only one part of a very balanced energy policy. Because even if its possible for shale to become a major factor in those countries it will take a long time, it could take 10-15 years. But shale gas should be done alongside a lot of the other aspects of energy.
By the way, my impression is that Russia is not so negative about shale gas at this point. The people who I speak to in Russia have questions, which are reasonable questions. They want to know more and to learn more. And I don’t think that Russian energy officials and energy companies will keep their head in sand on shale. Over time they will explore the possibility and take a realistic view on that.
Q.: It seems that U.S. companies are not as active as they could in the energy sector in Russia. Or we can say that their activity is at the initial level. Is there any reason for such stagnation in energy cooperation between U.S. and Russia? And shall we expect new deals and approaches in this field? Maybe as an example of the reset in bilateral relations?
A.: It is one of areas where we want to work very much with our Russian colleagues and we hope that there will be new deals. And one of the purposes of my recent trip was to learn more about what kinds of deals in what areas Russia maybe more interested in getting Western technology and Western finance. And I think if companies look towards what Russia believes is in its interest more deals will become available, and regulatory and legal [issues] that maybe of some concern maybe more easily resolved. There are some deals in Russia. For instance, the most recent one Chevron-Rosneft deal on the Black Sea. Companies that are in Russia now feel like some issues that they have are resolvable. And companies I have spoken to are feeling fairly good about the situation. But as long as companies develop relationships of trust and communicate openly with their counterparts in Russia I think there is a very bright future.
Q.: There is an opinion that the United States is sponsoring non-government and ecological organizations that are criticizing investment and infrastructural projects in Asia-Pacific and generally in the East.
A.: If it is so I don’t know anything about that.
Q.: What is your view of the Russian energy presence in Asia-Pacific?
A.: I don’t see any reason why Russia should not be involved in that region. Russia is working closely in developing news relationships with China on energy. I mentioned South Korea – President Medvedev went to Seul a few weeks ago and offered gas to South Korea. I think it is a natural consequences of global competitive markets. Russia is going to diversify and look more and more on Asia. And it seems to me to perfectly appropriate.
Q.: U.S. companies working in Russia are quite independent in the implementation of their projects, almost at every stage, beginning with geological research up to the final product sales. Do you think that this policy is really efficient? So far there was only one project that was efficient Sakhalin-1. This year Chevron got 33% in the development of the some parts in the Black Sea. In any case do you see the risk in competition with Chinese and Japanese companies that have a completely different strategic approach to the development in Russia? They offer investments and credits first in exchange for the final energy supply.
A.: First of all, you have to understand that American companies that are working in Russia certainly operate independently from the United States government. We don’t interfere in what they are doing in Russia. And hopefully we are going to see more and more successes in American investments. One of the most successful companies in spite of the problems that they had a few years ago TNK-BP is doing extraordinary well and maybe a model for other investments. I think there will be more successes in then future. I don’t consider myself expert enough to compare Russian policy with Chinese to make publicly, or on the record any specific comments.
Q.: And my last question would be the North Stream and South Stream. What is the current attitude, the view of the United States, on these two projects? Do you support it? What is your view?
A.: First of all, on the North Stream. This project clearly going to take place, and countries like Germany will be involved in it. Previous administration liked to compare it with Molotov-Ribbentrop pact. And as a practical matter that project is up and going, and there are many countries in Europe that are doing it, and that is fine. With the respect to South Stream we have often stated that we don’t oppose the South Stream and that its really up to the countries involved. There interesting issues with the respect to the South Stream that are involved and we going to watch them closely.

description.hltext_display: EC Approves NSN + Motorola Deal
description.content: The European Commission has cleared the acquisition of Motorola Network Business by Nokia Siemens Networks. The deal was found not to significantly impede effective competition in the European Economic Area (EEA) or any substantial part of it.

description.hltext_display: Iirojen joulupaketista paljastui tuttu Iiro
description.content:
Pallo-Iirojen valmentaja Pasi Lehtonen ei liioitellut, kun hän uskoi Iiro Aallon sopimuskuvioiden ratkeavan joulukuun aikana. Kaksikko päätti tarjoilla raumalaiselle jalkapalloväelle kovan joulupaketin.
Jo viime kaudella kasvattajaseuraansa edustanut Veikkausliigakonkari kantaa jatkossakin sinikeltaisia värejä. Iirot ja Aalto solmivat kaksivuotisen sopimuksen ilman optioita.
– Heti ”Pantsen” jatkosopimuksen julkistamisen jälkeen tätä ruvettiin työstämään. Ajattelin, että jos kaksi vuotta vielä haluaisivat pitää meikäläisen, niin mikä ettei, Aalto virnistää.
Sanamuoto ei silti tarkoita sitä, että Aalto aikoisi naulata kahden vuoden kuluttua nappulakenkänsä seinään.
– Pelaan niin kauan, kun tuntuu, että pysyn vauhdissa. Kun itse tajuaa, että ei enää mukana pärjää, on aika siirtyä syrjään. En halua siinä vaiheessa jäädä sätkimään, Aalto miettii.
KIMMO MÄKELÄINEN, LÄNSI-SUOMI
Lue lisää keskiviikon Länsi-Suomesta.

description.hltext_display: Il pallone, la chimica dei materiali e i Maya
description.content:
Che gli antichi Maya sapessero fabbricare la gomma a partire dal lattice vegetale è cosa risaputa. Ma che giocassero a pallone proprio grazie alle loro avanzate nozioni di chimica dei materiali, è una recente scoperta di alcuni ricercatori del MIT di Boston.
Inserito da mferrarini il giorno 22/12/2010 alle 9.00 - Voti: 2 - Commenti: 0

description.hltext_display: Aumentan accidentes en menores de 6 años
description.content:
La mayoría de percances ocurre en el hogar. Archivo.
Angie López Arias
En estas vacaciones los accidentes en niños menores de seis años aumentan y aunque parezca increíble, el sitio donde más ocurren es en sus propias casas.
Rodolfo Hernández, director del Hospital Nacional de Niños, indicó que solo en diciembre, los incidentes de todo tipo aumentan en un 20 por ciento.
Las caídas son la principal causa de atención, pero además se presentan quemaduras, mordeduras de perro, intoxicaciones y agresión infantil.
Hernández dijo que la mitad de las lesiones que sufren los pequeños ocurre en el hogar, sobre todo quemaduras, intoxicaciones y caídas.
“Ahí los niños pasan la mayor parte del tiempo y un descuido puede provocar un accidente. Todo menor debe estar bajo vigilancia permanente”, dijo el médico.
Las edades de mayor riesgo son los menores de tres años, pero en general, los pequeños de menos de seis años son los más vulnerables a percances.
Según Hernández, también en esta época aumentan los casos de agresión infantil. En lo que va del año se han atendido más de dos mil menores agredidos.
“Desde el año 2000 la agresión contra niños ha aumentado de manera sostenida. Ese año se atendieron 375 casos y este ya superamos los dos mil”, agregó.
Hernández pide ser más cuidadosos con el uso de armas de fuego, pues en este 2010 de 10 casos atendidos por disparos murieron dos.

description.hltext_display: La lotería de Navidad reparte 2.320 millones de euros
description.content: Todo está ya preparado en el nuevo salón que alberga el sorteo de Navidad, en el Palacio de Congresos de Madrid, para que los bombos comiencen a girar y arrojen los 1.787 premios que repartirán más de 2.320 millones de euros.Ayer se completó en el remozado salón toda la parafernalia propia del sorteo y los empleados de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado (LAE) procedieron a colgar los números ...

description.hltext_display: Sin niños quemados este mes
description.content:
La pólvora está dejando de ser un problema. Archivo.
Fabio Parreaguirre Gamboa
Al parecer, la conciencia que se ha creado en torno al tema del manejo de la pólvora y los cuidados en la cocina con respecto a los niños, está dando frutos.
La Unidad de Quemados del Hospital Nacional de Niños (HNN), no ha recibido ningún pequeño en este mes de diciembre, cuando en años pasados, excluyendo el 2009, era otra la situación (el año pasado no hubo casos).
“Este año, no hemos registrado niños quemados en lo que va de diciembre; de hecho, en todo el año, solo hemos registrado cinco niños en esa unidad y fue en el mes de noviembre”, indicó el subdirector del centro hospitalario, Orlando Urroz.
“Esperamos que este año pase igual que el año pasado que terminamos diciembre sin quemados de consideración en nuestra unidad”, indicó.
“Todo esto es gracias a los programas que hemos realizado de manera preventiva, en conjunto con otras autoridades, como la Fuerza Pública y el Ministerio de Salud; además, tengo que agradecer a los medios de comunicación porque han emitido mucha información preventiva en este caso, principalmente respecto a la pólvora y al manejo de recipientes en las cocinas”, manifestó Urroz.

description.hltext_display: Santander es la octava ciudad más agraciada por el 'Gordo' de Navidad, que ha caído en ocho ocasiones
description.author: EUROPA PRESS
description.content:
EUROPA PRESS Santander es la octava ciudad española más agraciada por el Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad de la Lotería Nacional, ya que el 'Gordo' ha caído en ocho ocasiones en la capital cántabra. Santander es la octava ciudad española más agraciada por el Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad de la Lotería Nacional, ya que el 'Gordo' ha caído en ocho ocasiones en la capital cántabra. Ampliar foto Madrid es la localidad que más veces ha sido favorecida, ya que en ella ha recaído el 'Gordo' en 72 ocasiones en toda la historia del sorteo, según datos del Organismo Nacional de Loterías (ONLAE).
El año pasado, la capital volvió a acoger al número afortunado en el sorteo, repitiendo suerte por tercera vez consecutiva. Por el contrario, Barcelona —la segunda ciudad más afortunada— no fue agraciada el año pasado, por lo que mantiene la cifra de 37 'Gordos' del año pasado.
A ésta le siguen Sevilla, con quince, Valencia y Bilbao, con once y Zaragoza y Cádiz, con diez cada una. También han recibido la suerte de forma múltiple Santander en ocho ocasiones, Málaga y Granada, en siete, San Sebastián y Alicante en seis, Palma de Mallorca y Gijón en cinco, La Coruña y Vic (Barcelona) en cuatro y Badajoz, Burgos, Lugo, Pamplona y Sort (Lérida) en tres.
El 'Gordo' visitó en dos ocasiones Sabadell, Córdoba, Linares (Jaén), Lérida, Alora (Málaga), Murcia, Palencia, Logroño, Segovia, Alcira y Manises (Valencia), Vitoria y Valladolid.
De las grandes ciudades, sólo ha pasado una vez por Almería, Castellón, Ciudad Real, Cuenca, Guadalajara, Huesca, León, Oviedo, Pontevedra, Las Palmas y Teruel, además de en otras localidades de menor tamaño.

description.hltext_display: Namibia: Joshua Hoëbeb Returns to Public Duty
description.content:
THE regional governors were appointed after a new law and much was said before and after the fact.
Need I say more? Some were new faces to public duty at this level while some are not as new as they were recycled and reassigned to new regions. My former student Clinton Swartbooi was given one of the mineral-rich regions of Namibia, Karas, and, my brother Cleophas Mutjavikua was assigned to Erongo Region. Veendapi McLeod is one of those who returned to the same office in the same region while Samuel Nuuyoma retained the portfolio but moved to the capital to coordinate the most politically prominent region of the country. I take this opportunity to wish them all, only the best in their new assignment.
Among the governors features a political stalwart, an unwavering leader in civil society matters and tested pedagogue by name Joshua Hobeb. Think of Joshua Hobeb and many names spring to mind. Meester Bock, Pastor Kamho, Pastor Naholo, Pastor Kameeta, Jefta Tjozongoro, Phillip Tjerije, Kuzeeko Kangueehi. In another of his lives feature names such as Niko Bessinger, Bella Cupido, Mokganedi Tlhabanello, Rehabeam Kamehozu, Thomas Ihuhua, Comrade Kabinet, Fleming Aspara, Dave Smuts, Hartmut Ruppel, Anton Lubowski, Solomon Gamatham, Kuzaune Tjijenda, Meekulu Kondo, Lucia Hamutenya, Sii Maha, Ida Hofmann, Comrade Donkey and, I stop here: Comrade Maxuilili. Yes, those days were different in more ways than one for they were filled with complete devotion to national duty and there was love among our national leaders. Once Cross Currents carried a tribute to Bobby Samaria and the column was criticised for paying tribute to somebody who was still alive. That misplaced disapproval was rooted in the Namibian experience that teaches us to only recognise heroes once they die.
During the struggle we organised petrol-drum political rallies and people would stream from around the country to hear our leaders speak about the apartheid situation. The mainstay of the week would be a stage shared by speakers such as Kameeta, Mokganedi Thlabanello, Joshua Hobeb, Rikumbi Kandanga, Ida Jimmy, and Jesriel Taapopi, mixed in with Daniel Tjongarero as chairman. Joshua Hobeb was imbued with a hot tongue coated in bitter language that invoked deep hatred among members of the South African police at almost every Swapo rally he addressed. Oluno/Okatana rallies carry striking testimony. He spoke at a rally near Rundu chaired by Marco Hausiku and it culminated in pandemonium. Police helicopters hovered above the crowds with a voice dropping through loud-hailers: "Daar is hy, skiet hom !" Marco controlled the crowds. He mingled among the sea of people with a megaphone and pleaded: "Do not run away hold hands and bow your heads." The crowds obeyed, comrades formed a human shield around Joshua Hobeb somewhere in the crowd. Hobeb was saved and there were no major incidents.
In Katutura there was the shooting at Hobeb. There was a learners' strike at the Augustineum High School. Hobeb and I were on the school committee and we gathered at my house in Soweto to contemplate actions of the following day. Among those in attendance were Tives Mbako and Eeperi Ngaujake.
Somebody rushed into the meeting and alerted us that a hit squad was on its way to finish me off. We had abandoned the meeting and crossed the road to make a telephone call from Othniel Kazombiaze's house, when the squad arrived in a fourteen-seater white Toyota minibus. Hobeb tried to quietly make off and there was a chase. Three bullets hit the car, but Hobeb came out unscathed.
The week that followed had us all bottled with rage. One afternoon I arrived at Hobeb's house in Freedom Square. He looked much depressed and I wondered what had happened. He exclaimed in his soft-spoken style, but with evident anger: "Man, my ma het my kwaad gemaak."
He had kept a firearm, some Tokarev or Makarov or whatever the thing was, in his boxes of books at his mother's house on the fringes of Gemengde and Nama Lokasie. As if impelled by divine powers, his mother one day decided to go through his boxes and when she discovered the firearm, she dropped it down the man-hole cover of the ablution block behind the house. That is how my comrade lost this hard-gained item that he had kept just in case. When he asked the mother why she had done that she only said: "Ek soek jou nie in die tronk nie. Ek het genoeg probleme."
There are so many pages on my mind about this humble and soft-spoken man with the heart of a lion, but the space is limited. Congratulations Meester. I wish you the best that you have given this nation and think of me when you have a driver's job available - I live in some Reservaat in Omaheke Region!

description.hltext_display: Different Types Of Biometric Techniques For Your Home Safe
description.content: Installing a home safe is becoming a necessarily of the time. The increasing rate of crime is compelling the people to opt for a way to protect their valuable form any theft or burglary. Nothing can be better than installing a home safe that can keep your valuable safely. There are different types of lock techniques that were used in home safes. Earlier it was just a key that can provide you with the access to the safe and as the burglar's learnt the art of opening the safe the technology need to be improved. So there was an introduction of the biometric lock. In this the lock is programmed to test the biometric of the person accessing the home safe and matches with the data it has. It there is a match the access is provided and an entry is made in the form of transaction.If you are using biometric lock in home safe then in that case biometric of the family members are recorded in the home safe's data which makes the safe accessible to family members only. There are different types of biometric techniques that you can opt from: Voice recognition: it s a techniques in which the user have to provide the safety program with a sample of your voice. It matches the sample with its data if it is a match the access to safe is allowed. Though it is not very efficient but it is used in combination of other biometric techniques to raise the level of access security to home safes.Fingerprints: It is the most commonly used biometric technique. In this the fingerprints of all authorized person is recorded. Every type some one wants to access the safe then the fingerprints patterns are checked and if there is a match then the access is allowed.Retinal scan: among the biometric techniques, retinal scan is the latest. It uses the unique retinal patterns of each person for quick identification. Since every person have a different retinal pattern it gives access to only authorized persons. It is also next to impossible for thieves to get a retinal pattern that is exactly same as the retina pattern of the user.If we combine the retinal scan technique with the fingerprint scanning then it is the better possible way of keep our valuable safe from the thieves.

description.hltext_display: SentriLock Designates the Make-A-Wish Foundation® as its 2010...
description.content:
SentriLock, the number-one rated provider of electronic lockbox systems for the residential real estate industry, announced that it has designated the Make-A-Wish Foundation® as its holiday charity. SentriLock has made a donation to Make-A-Wish Foundation® and Make-A-Wish® Canada to equally represent all of its customers across North America.
Continuing last year’s theme, SentriLock chose a charity that helps children. Chris Ralstin, Senior Manager of Customer Relations, said, “Last year we chose Toys for Tots. This year, we still wanted to help children but wanted to pick a new charity to share with. Make-A-Wish Foundation® is a well-known charity that helps make children’s dreams come true at a time when the world can seem like a very dark place.”
Last year customers really appreciated the donation in their names. It allowed them to share in the joy and pride that goes with helping those in need. This year, customers are appreciating the donation again. Jan Santopietro, Association Executive of Pagosa Springs Area Association of REALTORS®, commented, “It was very thoughtful and a great idea to boot.”
About SentriLock
SentriLock is majority owned by the National Association of REALTORS® and is a proud partner in NAR's REALTOR Benefits® Program. The company’s REALTOR® NXT Electronic Lockbox System is known for its reliable and secure technology, ease of use and its outstanding customer service, rated tops in the industry for three years by two independent market research studies. We provide secure, easy and reportable access to every listing via more than 500,000 lockboxes in use by 250,000 Agents from over 210 different Boards, Associations and MLSs in the United States and Canada. SentriLock’s award-winning Customer Care Team provides world-class support seven days a week, exclusively from its headquarters in Cincinnati, Ohio. http://www.SentriLock.com or http://www.SentriLock.ca
About Make-A-Wish Foundation®
Since 1980, the Make-A-Wish Foundation® has enriched the lives of children with life-threatening medical conditions through its wish-granting work. The Foundation's mission reflects the life-changing impact that a Make-A-Wish® experience has on children, families, referral sources, donors, sponsors, and entire communities. The Make-A-Wish Foundation was founded in 1980 after a little boy named Chris Greicius realized his heartfelt wish to become a police officer. Since its humble beginnings, the organization has blossomed into a worldwide phenomenon, reaching more than 193,000 children around the world. http://www.wish.org/
About Make-A-Wish® Canada
The mission of Make-A-Wish® Canada is to grant the wishes of children with life-threatening medical conditions to enrich the human experience with hope, strength and joy.
Make-A-Wish Canada is a part of the largest wish-granting organization in the world and can be found in over 35 countries on five continents. The Make-A-Wish Foundation® of America grants the wishes of children in the United States, Guam and Puerto Rico through its 65 chapters, while Make-A-Wish Foundation® International serves children outside the United States in over 36 countries on five continents. With the help of generous donors and over 30,000 volunteers, the Make-A-Wish Foundation has granted more than 250,000 wishes worldwide since inception. Along with the national office, seven regional chapters grant magical wishes to children in need across Canada. http://www.makeawish.ca/

description.hltext_display: Indultan indígena
description.content:
El Consejo de Gobierno otorgó el indulto a la indígena Olivia Bejarano Bejarano, quien había sido condenada a 13 años de cárcel por un homicidio durante un juicio que no entendió, ya que no contó con traductor. Otra presa a la que se le perdonó la condena fue Sally Priscilla Calderón Oconitrillo, quien había sido encarcelada por introducir drogas a una prisión. En total se presentaron 45 solicitudes.
Caldera a un carril
La ruta 27 a Caldera tendrá el próximo domingo 26 y el domingo 2 de enero un solo sentido de circulación desde Ciudad Colón hasta Pozón, en Orotina. A partir de las 12 m.d. y hasta las 5 p.m. solo se circulará en el sentido Caldera-San José para facilitar el regreso de los conductores a la capital. La medida es parte del operativo de fin y principio de año, que ha sido tratado con el MOPT, el Consejo Nacional de Concesiones y la Policía de Tránsito.
Tendrán casas
Cuarenta casas nuevas en la urbanización Boulevard del Sol II, en Barranca, Puntarenas, se entregarán a familias en riesgo social o que viven en precarios. Esto gracias a la aprobación de la compra por parte del Banco Hipotecario de la Vivienda (Banhvi). Entre los beneficiados principales figuran 78 niños y jóvenes menores de edad y 39 mujeres jefas de hogar. En total se realizó una inversión de ¢475 millones provenientes del bono familiar.
Arte en el correo
El edificio central del Correo se convertirá en una galería de arte gracias a la exposición de pintura denominada “En las manos del Alfarero”, de la artista Magally Quirós Cruz. Se trata de obras hechas con acrílicos en distintas texturas visuales y táctiles. La muestra estará abierta al público a partir de esta semana y hasta el viernes 7 de enero en el salón principal del Correo Central. La entrada al evento será completamente gratis.

description.hltext_display: Jeffery Wayne Griffith, 59
description.content:
in Muncie, IN. Died December 19, 2010 in Irving, TX, from lung cancer.
Preceded in death by his parents, Robert and Lois (Dragoo) Griffith, Parker City, IN; brother, Dale Griffith, Parker City, IN; and daughter Angela Mary Anne Griffith, Fort Wayne, IN.
Survived by loving daughters, Heather Jane Link (husband Keith), Irving, TX, Melissa Christian Griffith, Irving, TX, and Emily Renee Griffith, Houston, TX. Also mourned by his three grandchildren, who brought him great joy, Isaiah Christopher Edwards, Laura Emily Link, and namesake, Jeffery James Link, all of Irving, TX.
A long term resident of Lexington, KY. He was employed by Quebecor in Versailles, KY.
Internment with his parents at Elm Ridge Funeral Home and Memorial Park, 4600 W. Kilgore Avenue, Muncie, IN 47304.

description.hltext_display: Obama signing 'don't ask, don't tell' repeal
description.author: MARK S. SMITH
description.content:
WASHINGTON -- Fulfilling a campaign pledge, cheering his party's downcast liberals and striking a blow for what he sees as basic human rights, President Barack Obama is signing a landmark law Wednesday that tells America's armed services to let homosexuals serve openly for the first time.
So many gay rights and Democratic activists were expected at the signing ceremony that the White House booked a large auditorium at the Interior Department.
"This day has come!" said an elated Mike Almy, an Air Force major discharged four years ago when his sexual orientation became known. "'Don't ask, don't tell' is over, and you no longer have to sacrifice your integrity."
While the elation is real, Pentagon officials caution it could be premature, since the bill requires service chiefs to complete implementation plans before lifting the old policy - and certify to lawmakers that it won't damage combat readiness, as critics charge.
Also, guidelines must be finalized that cover a host of practical questions, from how to educate troops to how sexual orientation should be handled in making barracks assignments.
While officials have avoided timetables, the process will probably take months.
Still, for gay and lesbian Americans, Wednesday is a watershed. And for Obama, it is a day to revel in the achievement of a goal he's long championed.
It is also the second of three expected victories in what's turned out to be - for Obama - a surprisingly productive lame-duck Congress. Weeks after his self-described "shellacking" in the midterm vote, he's won lopsided approval of a tax cut compromise, and the Senate is poised to deliver his top foreign policy goal: ratification of a new nuclear arms treaty with Russia.
Many Democratic liberals were furious over the tax package, believing Obama blithely yielded to Republican demands to retain the same tax cuts for the rich he had loudly denounced on the campaign trail. That's not the case with the repeal of don't ask, don't tell. Lifting of the ban on gays serving openly was something Obama not only campaigned on in 2008 but reiterated in this year's State of the Union speech.
"I will work with Congress and our military to finally repeal the law that denies gay Americans the right to serve the country they love because of who they are," he said in January to cheers in the House chamber, adding, "It's the right thing to do."
Born 17 years ago as a compromise between President Bill Clinton and a resistant Pentagon, the "don't ask, don't tell" policy became for gay rights campaigners a notorious roadblock on the way to full acceptance.
Speaking in June at a Gay Pride Month observance at the White House, Obama likened the fight to end it to the struggle of American blacks for civil rights.
"We have never been closer to ending this discriminatory policy," he declared.
Yet he has also faced rising discontent among gay activists who believed he hadn't moved forcefully enough. He's been heckled at campaign appearances over AIDS funding and the failure to end the military service ban.
Obama countered that as commander-in-chief, he had to ensure the ban's end is carefully prepared for.
That's just what the bill from Congress mandates.
"The implementation and certification process will not happen immediately; it will take time," Air Force Chief of Staff Gen. Norton Schwartz warned in an e-mail that went out right after Saturday's Senate vote. "Meanwhile, the current law remains in effect. All Air Force members should conduct themselves accordingly."
Military and administration officials are wrestling with numerous legal questions raised by the end of the ban - knowing that courts are waiting in the wings. They include what to do about pending expulsion proceedings, and when those ousted under don't-ask-don't-tell might apply to rejoin the armed forces.
For Almy, who appeared at a Capitol Hill ceremony Monday, the important thing is that gay and lesbian service members are no longer singled out because of who they love.
"That's all we ever wanted," he told reporters, "not special rights, just the same as our straight counterparts. "

description.hltext_display: Un inmenso pesar
description.content:
Recuerdo la voz dolida de William Solano cuando, me comunicaba que tenían una tragedia en un túnel de Arenal. Y que en ella estaban involucrados Miguel Dengo, jefe del proyecto, y nuestros compañeros cineastas Edgar Trigueros y Luis Ramírez.
Yo me imaginé de inmediato un derrumbe dentro del túnel. La cosa había sido peor. Los tres viajaban en una lancha, junto con nuestro compañero Carlos Sáenz, otros ingenieros del ICE y “Hooligan”, el conductor de la lancha.
Y por una malhadada jugada del destino, se acercaron a un vertedero del lago y cayeron por una de las bocas de desagüe.
Los tres primeros citados perecieron trágicamente, luego de una caída de 50 metros de altura y unos 300 metros de corrida horizontal por el conducto de salida de las aguas.
Sáenz y “Hooligan” se salvaron de milagro. Los otros pudieron saltar a tiempo, pero Miguel, Edgar y Luis se toparon con su trágico destino. Hoy nos queda un recuerdo imperecedero y un inmenso pesar. Empezaba apenas la crisis de los ochenta.
Y a nosotros, en el Centro de Cine y en el ICE, ya nos golpeaba de una manera directa, en la humanidad de compañeros queridos. Desde entonces, el Centro de Cine ya no volvió a ser lo mismo.
Quedó signado cuando apenas daba sus primeros pasos. Luchamos contra la adversidad, mas el recuerdo de estos tres jóvenes casi nos derrumba, tal cual fue su doloroso derrotero.

description.hltext_display: SBAB höjer korta boräntorna
description.content: Det statliga bolåneinstitutet SBAB höjer sina boräntor igen. På onsdagen börjar nya räntor gälla för de kortare bindningstiderna. Enligt ett pressmeddelande från SBAB höjs räntorna med tre månaders bindning med 0,08 procentenheter till 3,21 procent och räntorna på ett års bindning med 0,06 till 3,59 procent. Övriga räntor behålls oförändrade.

description.hltext_display: Exit and Emergency Lightings Are Important In Offices and Buildings
description.content: It is implemented by law that buildings and offices should have safety requirements such as exit and emergency lighting systems installed. These are necessary to be installed incase of emergency and people do not indulge in any mishaps or accidents. It is enforced by law that exit paths in offices and buildings should have clearly marked evacuation and emergency lights systems.Enclosed places in these places should have proper emergency lights incase if the normal supply of electricity fails. This will help people to see and have visibility and they can be able to do their work or can walk easily in and out of these places. You should install emergency lightings in such places to avoid accidents and people getting hurt because of no lights. These lights are installed on walls and they are operated by battery and some are chargeable as well.Other forms of lights are safety lights and they are installed on the stairs of buildings and offices so that people can evacuate easily with proper visibility incase if any emergency arises to evacuate the premises. These lights will help people to see clearly and they will avoid having accidents and falling from stairs as well. These lights are installed which will guide people to proper exit way and they can easily find themselves out of the premises.You should have proper exit ways on each floor of the premises with proper exit lightings installed so that people can see where exactly the exit way is. These exits should be free from obstructions and it should be a clear path so that people can escape safely. The exit ways should be guided with exit lightings installed. These lightings should be installed near the exit ways so that people can see the exit sign and then they can use the way.You can see that almost every buildings and offices have emergency lightings and exit lightings installed properly as they have to abide by the rules and regulations of the government. If you will fail to provide these facilities you might be fined for failure to do so.These exit signs should be illuminated at all times as you never know when an emergency may arise and there are number of people in buildings who live or work there and plus general people do come as well so these lightings should be in working order at all times. These lights are very helpful incase if fire breaks out in the building and the normal supply of electricity is suspended, the fumes created by fire is heavy and can cause choking and cause hindrance in vision. So in such cases emergency lights are used and they can provide sufficient visibility to people to escape and the exit lightings should also be working so that people can see the sign in panic situations and use the exit path safely.These lightings are made compulsory by state to be installed in every building whether it is commercial or residential project.

description.hltext_display: Progresele Croaţiei în negocierile de aderare la UE, subminate de arestarea lui Ivo Sanader - ...
description.author: redactia@romanialibera.ro (Victor Turșan
description.content:
Progresele înregistrate de Croaţia în negocierile de aderare la Uniunea Europeană, care ar putea încheia miercuri încă trei capitole, ajungând la 28 din 35, au fost subminate de scandalul arestării fostului premier Ivo Sanader, anchetat pentru corupţie, comentează Financial Times în ediţia online, potrivit Mediafax.
Uniunea nu va permite Croaţiei să adere înainte de soluţionarea "satisfăcătoare" a problemei corupţiei, apreciază publicaţia. Una dintre "ciudăţeniile" Uniunii este că are mai multă putere asupra membrilor săi înainte de aderare, decât după încheierea procesului.
Publicaţia citează exemplul aderării României şi Bulgariei, la 1 ianuarie 2007, cu programe de luptă contra corupţiei în desfăşurare, în care s-au înregistrat puţine progrese de atunci. "Lecţia este că asemenea probleme sunt cel mai bine abordate înainte de consumarea stimulentului aderării", subliniază Financial Times.
Însă cel mai mare pericol al admiterii premature a Croaţiei este că aderarea unei alte ţări cu probleme poate întoarce Uniunea contra unor extinderi ulterioare. Însă politica de extindere este unul dintre marile succese ale Uniunii, permiţând stabilirea democraţiei şi domniei legii în ţări cu o istorie de autocraţie şi instabilitate. Dar cum interesul Uniunii este să implementeze aceste principii în Balcani, accelerarea admiterii Croaţiei nu ar trebui să supună acest scop la riscuri.
Pentru a adera fără ridicarea acestor probleme, Croaţia trebuie să arate că are şi doreşte să utilizeze mecanisme robuste contra corupţiei în sectorul public, susţine FT. Iar Zagrebul a înregistrat, deja, progrese în acest sens, publicaţia exemplificând cu aprobarea de către Parlament a unei legi care permite confiscarea averii dobândită ilegal. De asemenea, au fost "prinşi câţiva peşti mari", ca fostul vicepremier condamnat, în octombrie, pentru abuz de putere, iar fostul ministru al Apărării condamnat, la 6 decembrie, la patru ani de închisoare pentru corupţie.
Însă aceste acţiuni contra unor oficiali de rang înalt subliniază, concomitent, cât de răspândită a fost corupţia în această ţară. O investigare corespunzătoare a acuzaţiilor contra fostului premier Ivo Sanader, arestat la 10 decembrie în Austria, sub acuzaţii de corupţie, este o condiţie necesară pentru aderarea Croaţiei la UE, dar nu suficientă. În plus, Zagrebul trebuie să demonstreze, în mod convingător, că a lăsat în urma sa o cultură răspândită a corupţiei şi impunităţii, conchide Financial Times.

description.hltext_display: Fuego dejó sin casa a 42 personas
description.content:
El fuego arrasó ayer con siete viviendas. Pablo Montiel.
Miguel Calderón Suárez
El Alto, Goicoechea - Un incendio ocurrido ayer a las 7:55 a. m. dejó sin vivienda a 42 personas en el residencial Las Arboledas en El Alto de Guadalupe, Goicoechea.
Un corto circuito en una de las casas de madera, fue, según el Cuerpo Nacional de Bomberos, lo que originó presuntamente el fuego. Luis Fernando Salas, de dicha institución, comentó que en total fueron destruidas siete viviendas y otra presentó daños parciales. Los cuerpos de socorro tardaron 19 minutos en controlar las llamas y luego realizaron labores de escombreo.
Personal de la Compañía Nacional de Fuerza y Luz (CNFL) se encargó de cortar el fluido eléctrico para poder controlar la labor y que así las llamas se pudieran apagar con normalidad.
1021 afectados
Durante el año, un total de 679 adultos y 342 niños han perdido su vivienda a consecuencia de los incendios. Esta cifra se deriva de las 219 conflagraciones que han investigado los peritos del Cuerpo de Bomberos durante el 2010.
En esos mismos 219 siniestros investigados, los socorristas determinaron que se han quemado más de 35 mil metros cuadrados de construcción, mientras que han logrado salvar más de 337 mil metros cuadrados.
En total los bomberos han atendido, durante el 2010, más de 730 emergencias a causa del fuego en estructuras, en los cuales ya han fallecido 17 personas, la cifra más alta de los últimos cuatro años.

description.hltext_display: El sorteo de la lotería de Navidad estrena este año un nuevo salón de ceremonias
description.author: EUROPA PRESS
description.content:
EUROPA PRESS El Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad de Lotería Nacional estrena este año un nuevo salón de ceremonias en el Palacio de Congresos de Madrid, tras más de 40 años repartiendo premios 'Gordos' en el salón de sorteos de la calle Guzmán el Bueno. El Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad de Lotería Nacional estrena este año un nuevo salón de ceremonias en el Palacio de Congresos de Madrid, tras más de 40 años repartiendo premios 'Gordos' en el salón de sorteos de la calle Guzmán el Bueno. Ampliar foto "Últimamente había ya muchos problemas de espacio, debido a la gran cantidad de público que asiste al sorteo y al gran número de periodistas acreditados", señala el director de Gestión y Producción de Loterías del Estado, Eduardo Ovies. Además, añade que la sala llevaba "mucho tiempo cerrado, sin ninguna actividad", lo que "invitaba a que este año fuera el definitivo para hacer el Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad fuera de ese lugar".
Esta es la primera vez desde 1963 que el sorteo no se celebrará en el Salón de Sorteos de Guzmán el Bueno. "Antes de escoger el Palacio de Congresos de Madrid, estudiamos distintas alternativas, entre ellas IFEMA, el Palacio de Congresos Municipal, el Teatro de Madrid, el salón del Consejo Superior de Deportes y el salón del Ministerio de Economía y Hacienda", explica Ovies.
Finalmente, se eligió el Palacio de Congresos porque se encuentra en el centro de la capital y dispone de un aforo de 1.909 personas, suficiente para la prensa y las personas que tradicionalmente acuden cada año el día del sorteo. Asimismo, se encuentra próximo a la actual sede de Loterías del Estado.
A lo largo de su historia, los sorteos de Lotería se han celebrado en distintos emplazamientos, como en la Plaza de San Ildefonso, donde se celebró el primer sorteo en 1763, el Ministerio de Economía y Hacienda, en la Fábrica Nacional de Moneda y Timbre, situada en la Plaza de Colón y en la Calle de Montalbán.
En el siglo XIX, hacia 1847, la dirección general de Loterías se sitúa en el Palacio de los Consejos, ubicado en la Calle Mayor, 79 de Madrid. Posteriormente, pasó por distintos emplazamientos hasta localizarse en 1932, durante la II República, en la calle de Montalbán. En esta sede, se realizó el sorteo hasta su traslado a la calle Guzmán el Bueno en 1963, coincidiendo con el bicentenario de la Lotería Nacional.
El 27 de abril de 2009 se inauguró el nuevo salón de Loterías situado en la Calle Capitán Haya de Madrid, donde se celebran de forma pública el resto de sorteos.

description.hltext_display: Boeing to announce soon 787 test flight return
description.content:
Boeing Co said on Wednesday that it will soon announce the resumption of test flights for its 787 Dreamliner plane, which have been halted since last month due to technical problems. "Probably the next announcement from Boeing would be an announcement of a return to flight tests. We expect that announcement very soon," Boeing Japan President Mike Denton told reporters, referring to the 787's delivery schedule.
Last week, the airplane maker said it would know over the "next few weeks" what impact a 787 Dreamliner electrical glitch will have on the plane's production and delivery schedule after test flights for the plane were halted after a problem with the electrical system caused a fire on one of the planes.

description.hltext_display: Per la vergine Maria
description.content:
Oh cara Madonnina luce luminosa d’amore madre della forza infinita nascosta nel cuore della fede. Coraggio e semplicità in te ho teneramente scoperto. Ti ho sempre cercato per ringraziarti dell’aiuto che mi hai donato ma non ti ho mai trovato perché ti sento nel profondo del mio cuore dell’amore innamorato.
Inserito da poesia il giorno 22/12/2010 alle 8.54 - Voti: 2 - Commenti: 0

description.hltext_display: Catherine M. Duncan, 79
description.content:
in Muncie to the late Raymond and Jincie Hyde. She graduated from Muncie Central High School in 1949. Following graduation she married Emmett Duncan on November 24, 1949. She spent her life as a homemaker and had also managed a local Dairy Queen Restaurant.
Catherine was saved at Foresquare Gospel Church and had also attended Riverside Baptist Church. She enjoyed playing the keyboard, singing, ceramics, gardening, and was an avid Euchre player. She had also been very active in Cub Scouts and Girl Scouts when her children were younger.
Catherine is survived by her loving husband of 61 years, Emmett Duncan; their three children, Daniel L. Duncan (wife Fran) of Henderson, NV, Diana E. Dobbs (husband Jack) of Muncie, and James R. Duncan (wife Jodi) of Brownsburg; six grandchildren, Josh Dobbs (wife Tiffane), Ashley Patton (husband Chris), Amanda Duncan, Ethan Duncan, Jacob Duncan, and Chase Duncan; six great-grandchildren; a sister, Jane Austin (husband Don) of Florida; and several nieces and nephews.
Catherine was preceded in death by her parents and five brothers.
A funeral service to celebrate Catherine's life will be 1 p.m. Thursday, December 23, 2010 at Elm Ridge Funeral Home at 4600 W. Kilgore Ave, Muncie. Burial will follow in Elm Ridge Memorial Park.
Friends and family may gather to share and remember two hours prior to services from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Elm Ridge Funeral Home.
Memorial contributions may be given to A.R.F. with envelopes provided at the funeral home or at 1209 W. Riggin Rd., Muncie, IN, 47303.
View memorial video and send online condolences at http://www.elmridgefuneralhome.com

description.hltext_display: Total lunar eclipse visible Tuesday in Korea
description.content:
The total lunar eclipse, second ever this year, was observed from 5:12 p.m. Tuesday on the Korean Peninsula.
People were able to see the lunar eclipse for about 40 minutes till 5:53, according to the Korea Astrology and Space Research Institute.
The total lunar eclipse occurred when the Sun, the Earth, and the Moon stand straight in that order, causing Earth to shadow the Moon.
“The Earth started to eclipse the moon at 2:27 p.m. and lasted until 8:06 p.m., ” a researcher said. “The total eclipse started at 4:40 p.m. but citizens were unable to watch it till 5:12 as the moon did not rise.”
He said that as the Moon gradually revolved out of Earth’s shadow, it was able to reflect more sunlight, thus returning to its originally bright condition at 7:01 p.m.

description.hltext_display: Tres sobreviven de milagro
description.content:
Helicóptero de Aerodiva cayó a tierra tras golpe en sus dos hélices
El helicóptero quedó golpeado parcialmente. Los tripulantes están delicados. Alejandro Nerdrick.
El piloto de la nave fue remitido al hospital México en condición grave, informó la Cruz Roja. Marcela Bertozzi.
Miguel Calderón Suárez y Alejandro Nerdrick
Batán, Limón. - Un helicóptero de la compañía de aviación Aerodiva se desplomó ayer a las 2:30 p.m. en las cercanías del río Barbilla, en Batán de Limón, informaron las autoridades locales.
La aeronave, una Bell 205 A1, cayó a unos 30 minutos de la escuela Puriscaleña, en Batán.
En el lugar, resultaron heridos los tripulantes de la nave Juan Gilberto Pineda Rivera (piloto salvadoreño) y los acompañantes José Torres Torres (funcionario del AyA) y el copiloto Ariel Zamora Chaves, según información de la Cruz Roja Costarricense.
Al parecer, la nave transportaba tubería e insumos para la construcción de un acueducto, cuando un golpe de las hélices, aparentemente contra un árbol, hizo que el aparato se viniera abajo.
Pineda, Torres y Zamora fueron extraídos por equipos de rescate y trasladados en avioneta hacia Base 2 del aeropuerto Juan Santamaría. Luego fueron llevados al hospital México.
Según fuentes de vigilancia aérea, el lugar es una densa zona montañosa y está a 40 minutos a pie del poblado más cercano llamado Puriscaleña de Batán.
“El piloto fue remitido al hospital México en condición delicada, presentaba un trauma severo en el cráneo; de momento está consiente”, explicó el cruzrojista Arnoldo Sanabria.
Carlos Vargas, gerente de Aerodiva comentó ayer a este medio que Torres le dijo que “iban de regreso después de descargar un material cuando sintió que algo golpeó una de las paletas de la nave y tuvieron que realizar lo que los pilotos llaman una “autorotación” que les permitió aterrizar de emergencia a la orilla del río.
“Fue un gran susto cuando me llamaron para decirme que el helicóptero había sufrido un incidente, pensé lo peor, pasamos de ser rescatistas a ser rescatados”.

description.hltext_display: Lose Weight Eating the Foods You Love
description.content:
One of Dr. Agatston's favorites: Steam some fresh or frozen cauliflower in the microwave. Then spray the cauliflower with butter substitute, add a little nonfat half-and-half substitute, and puree in a food processor or blender. "Salt and pepper to taste and you've got something that quite honestly can compete with the real thing any day," says Dr. Agatston. To make it even better, try adding roasted garlic, cheese, or sour cream to the mixture.
Added by MH Editors, 08/13/10 | flag
arrows
3
Lasagna
Slice four to five medium-size zukes lengthwise into three-quarter-inch-thick strips, instructs Lise Battaglia, a New Jersey chef whose past clients include Jon Bon Jovi. Sprinkle Italian seasoning on the strips, place them in a single layer on a nonstick cookie sheet, and bake at 425 degrees F for 20 minutes. You want them firm, not crisp. "Then simply make the lasagna as you normally would, replacing lasagna noodles with the baked zucchini," she says.
Added by MH Editors, 08/13/10 | flag
arrows
4
Spaghetti
A cooked spaghetti squash is like Mother Nature's automatic spaghetti maker—the flesh becomes noodlelike strands. "All you have to do is cut the squash in half and remove the seeds. Then place each half—cut side down—on a plate with a quarter cup of water," says Elizabeth Perreault, a chef at Colorado's Culinary School of the Rockies. Nuke the squash for 10 minutes or until it's soft to the touch. Let it cool, then scrape out the "spaghetti" strands and top with pasta sauce and cheese.
Added

description.hltext_display: 'Quería tenis y Play Station'
description.content:
Familiares despidieron a fallecidos. Yariela Novo.
Yariela Novo Cárdenas, colaboradora
Para Jason León esta será una Navidad atípica de las muchas que ha vivido. Él, junto con sus siete hermanos y su mamá, sentirán la ausencia de su padre Alberto León Sánchez y su hermano de 12 años, quienes fallecieron en un aparatoso choque anteayer.
La despedida se dio entre aplausos, por lo servicial del padre y la imitación del hijo.
“Usted es muy querido por el pueblo, mi hermano fue un hombre luchador que nunca abandonó a sus hijos”, se escuchó entre la multitud, mientras metían el ataúd a la bóveda.
“Él siempre tenía planes con sus hijos en las navidades, pasaban en familia, pero todo se truncó”, comentó Carlos León, hermano de Alberto.
El menor fallecido quería para la Navidad unas tenis y un Play Station.
“Nosotros no teníamos nada planeado para estos días, siempre salía algo improvisado, el regalo que siempre hemos pedido es una casa”, afirmó Jason.
Dolidos
Carlos León, hermano y tío.
Mi hermano era una gran persona, se quitaba el bocado para dárselo a cualquiera, lo recordaré por su apoyo”.
Jason León, hermano e hijo.
Mi hermano era muy vacilón y muy coqueto, con 12 años era un pícaro, un galán en el barrio, yo no sabía que tenía novia”.

description.hltext_display: Harlingen Family Dentistry Donates $25,000 to Community Outreach...
description.content:
The city’s Community Outreach Center “ The Bridge” - a project designed to ease the threat of youth crime and gang violence in the Harlingen area - got a big boost this month as longtime Harlingen dentist Dr. Juan Villarreal presented a $25,000 check to directors of the project.
The donation includes proceeds from the Nov. 13 “Fun Fest to Help Harlingen Youth,” an event sponsored by Villarreal’s Harlingen Family Dentistry to benefit the multipurpose center, which will provide counseling, education and job training programs provided by various agencies and ministries.
City leaders earlier this autumn approved the use of the old Harlingen Police Department building for the center. The Harlingen Family Dentistry donation accounts for more than 10 percent of the $200,000 contributions needed to complete renovations of the building.
Villarreal delivered the check to Tommy Ramirez, Chief Probation Officer for the Darrell Hester Juvenile Justice Department, who is spearheading the project.
"The coming together of our staff to help the community created a lot of excitement,” Villarreal said. “The Harlingen Family Dentistry family is proud to have a part in making a difference by improving the opportunities for youth in our community."
The Bridge will target at-risk youth, providing educational, counseling and job training to give them tools to make a productive life and career. It is the result of collaboration between the HPD’s gang unit and the Cameron County Juvenile Justice Department. The city recently agreed to a lease agreement for the old police building, and has also agreed to pay the utilities for the center for the next 20 years.
Funds raised from the public will be used to repair the roof, air conditioning and other renovations.
The Nov. 13 Fun Fest included entertainment, music, food and games at the Harlingen Family Dentistry complex at 1214 Dixieland Road.
While the HPD’s gang unit has made inroads in enforcement, law officers are looking to longer-term solutions, Ramirez says. The goal for the center – which includes not only law enforcement, but various service providers and ministries – is to make a positive intervention into the lives of youth and redirect Services at the one-stop shop will include
GED program
Vocational program
General counseling
Job training
Job placement
Home construction program
Spiritual counseling and ministries
Drug counseling
Life skills
Family services
Dr. Juan Villarreal DDS
Dr. Villarreal, a Rio Grande Valley native, opened his Harlingen practice in 1983. It is now one of the largest privately owned practices in the country.
Harlingen Family Dentistry
1214 Dixieland Rd. #4
Harlingen, Texas 78552

description.hltext_display: Namibia: Clampdown on Crime in Khomas Region
description.content:
THE Namibian Police, assisted by the Special Reserve Force, have started with their anti-crime campaign in Windhoek.
Their main tools are mobile roadblocks and foot patrols. At the roadblocks drivers are asked to show their licences and each vehicle is searched.
The Police are looking for housebreaking implements such as crowbars and bolt cutters, controlled substances such as dagga, stolen goods, unlicensed firearms and wanted persons.
The foot patrols are looking for people carrying dangerous weapons and even legally licensed firearms while under the influence of alcohol.
This operation will go on until the end of March, after which another crime prevention campaign will start.
"We will not stop until the crime rate is reduced by at least 40 per cent in the [Khomas] region," said Deputy Commissioner Andreas Nelumbu.
During the day Police officers are deployed to the city centre to deter break-ins into vehicles, pickpockets and bag snatchers.
A new permanent roadblock has been put up 31 kilometres from Okahandja on the road to Otjiwarongo.
"There are many accidents on that stretch of road and with this roadblock we are hoping to prevent them," said Nelumbu.
So far this holiday season there has been only one fatal accident in the Khomas Region - one person was killed when two buses collided north of Okahandja.
Nelumbu added that since a meeting was held between the Police and farmers of the Okahandja and Karibib districts, the Police have been patrolling the area and also used a helicopter to look for cattle rustlers' hideouts.
No one has been arrested so far but there is now constant communication between farmers and the Police.

description.hltext_display: Le cae 'perling'
description.content:
David Centeno Castro, de 24 años de edad, falleció ayer luego de que un “perling” le cayera encima mientras trabajaba en la construcción de la ferretería EPA en Colima de Tibás, informó el OIJ. El accidente se registró a las 7:30 a.m. El occiso era vecino de Guanacaste.
En libertad
Cartago.- El chofer de la empresa Lumaca, de apellido Brenes, sospechoso de atacar a cuchilladas a un joven pasajero por un problema con la marca del autobús, quedó libre la tarde de ayer por orden del Juez Penal de Cartago informo el OIJ. Entre tanto, su víctima, Mario Pereira Carvajal, de 22 años, fue dado de alta ayer en el Hospital Max Peralta. Colaboró F. Gutiérrez
Lo capturaron
Limón.- La Policía detuvo a dos hombres de apellidos Núñez y González, sospechosos de asaltar a una pareja, amordazar al hombre y violar a la joven, antier en barrio San Bosco de La Rita de Pococí. La captura se dio en la comunidad de Tarire de Pococí, 150 metros al sur de la escuela de la localidad, cuando los sujetos escapaban rumbo a Ticabán. Colaboró Reiner Montero.
Cayó reo en fuga
Buenos Aires.- Alexánder Carranza Carvajal,el reo en fuga del Centro de Adaptación Social de Pérez Zeledón hace un mes, fue capturado ayer en una finca ganadera en el poblado conocido como Las Hamacas de Pithier, de Biolley, del cantón de Buenos Aires de Puntarenas.El hombre descontaba una pena de 25 años por asesinar a un taxista. Colaboró A. Quesada

description.hltext_display: Multa por una quema en Tama sin permiso y en un día de calor y con viento
description.author: EUROPA PRESS
description.content:
EUROPA PRESS La Dirección General de Biodiversidad del Gobierno de Cantabria ha impuesto una multa de cien euros a un vecino de Piélagos por efectuar una quema en la localidad de Tama (Cillorigo de Liébana) sin tener permiso para ello y en un día de calor y con viento. La Dirección General de Biodiversidad del Gobierno de Cantabria ha impuesto una multa de cien euros a un vecino de Piélagos por efectuar una quema en la localidad de Tama (Cillorigo de Liébana) sin tener permiso para ello y en un día de calor y con viento. Ampliar foto Según la notificación de la resolución, consultada por Europa Press, los hechos que han dado lugar a la sanción fueron denunciados por la Guardia Civil de Potes.
Los hechos ocurrieron en la tarde del pasado 19 de marzo y, según consta en la resolución, fueron comprobados a las 18,20 horas por los agentes denunciantes.
En concreto, el motivo del expediente ha sido efectuar una quema en la localidad de Tama (Cillorigo de Liébana), sin estar el expedientado en posesión de la preceptiva autorización de la Dirección General de Biodiversidad.
Además, y según consta en la resolución, dicha quema se efectuó fuera del horario permitido, sin vigilancia alguna de la misma, y en una tarde calurosa y ventosa.
Estos hechos constituyen una infracción leve a lo establecido en la Ley de Montes y lleva aparejada una multa de cien euros.
No obstante, contra la resolución, el sancionado podrá interponer recurso de alzada ante el consejero de Desarrollo Rural, Ganadería, Pesca y Biodiversidad, dentro del plazo de un mes contado a partir del día siguiente a la fecha de notificación.

description.hltext_display: Liza June (Johnson) Adkins
description.content:
June was born in Grimsley, Tennessee to Etta Mae (Pryor) and James Gilbert Powell. She was a graduate of Clinton High School and earned an Associate of Arts degree from Ball State University. In 1964, she was accepted into to a government technical school at their Atomic Energy Facilities in Oak Ridge, Tennessee to study as a scientific glassblower. In 1968, she moved to Muncie and began a 20 year career at Ball State University in this unique profession.
June participated in many volunteer activities during her lifetime: Anderson Center for Chemical Dependency, Meals on Wheels, and American Healthcare Network. She was a tireless advocate for the acceptance, treatment, and understanding of mental health illnesses. She also held social group meetings in her home, the favorite of which was her Ladies Crochet Club. She was a devoted member and passionate missionary for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints. She served faithfully in the LDS Family History Center and as Single Adult Representative.
She is survived by her three daughters, Kathryn McCartney (Husband, Tim); Linda Haskins (Husband, Mike); and Tracy Pereira (Husband, Edson). Her surviving grandchildren include, Amanda McCartney, Jesse Beaty (wife, Christina), and Julia Beaty, Michael, Daniel, and Sara Haskins, Ross, Grant, and Blake Pereira and two great-grandchildren, Logan and Que Beaty. She is also survived by a very special niece whom she helped raise, Nada Amburn, and her son, Steve Amburn.
Services will be held 11:00 a.m. Thursday, December 23, 2010, at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints, 4800 W. Robinwood Dr., Muncie, IN 47304, with Bishop Robert Alcorn officiating. Burial will follow in Gardens of Memory Cemetery. Friends may call at Parson Mortuary from 5:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m. Wednesday, December 22, 2010, or one hour prior to time of service Thursday at the church.
Memorials may be sent to Delaware County Mental Health Association, 2517 W. 8th. St., Muncie, IN 47302.
Online condolences may be directed to the family at http://www.parsonmortuary.com.

description.hltext_display: AAIA reschedules legislative summit
Geheimnisvolle zwölf Nächte
description.content:
Hilpoltstein (HK) Die langen Winterabende waren in früheren Zeiten besonders dazu angetan, Brauchtum zu pflegen. Dabei waren der Fantasie keine Grenzen gesetzt und recht geheimnisvolle Geschichten ranken sich um die Nächte, in denen man besonders viel Zeit hatte. Dazu zählen auch die zwölf Nächte nach dem Christtag.
Sie spielten vor allem im bäuerlichen Volksleben von Alters her eine bedeutsame Rolle. Während der "zwölf Nächte" fand in früheren Jahren selten eine Hochzeit statt, glaubte man doch, dass die Ehe dann recht unglücklich verlaufen würde. Noch im 19. Jahrhundert zogen in den Tagen nach Weihnachten die Lehrer mit den Kindern von Haus zu Haus und sangen Weihnachtslieder. Das dabei eingebrachte Weihnachtsgeld kam zuerst dem Lehrer zu, später ging es dann in die Kirchenkasse über.
Vieles durfte man in den "zwölf Nächten" nicht tun. So war es nicht erlaubt, sich auf den Tisch zu setzen, weil man sonst dort Geschwüre bekam, wo sie besonders schmerzhaft waren. Man durfte in der Zeit nicht waschen oder gar Wäsche aufhängen. Es hieß, man hänge Häute auf, was bedeutete, dass dann bald der Tod ins Haus käme.
In der Zeit zwischen Weihnachten und dem Dreikönigstag durften keine Hülsenfrüchte gekocht werden, denn damit hätte man ja ein Arme-Leute-Essen zu sich genommen. Mit Ausnahme von Silvester durfte das Spinnrad nicht angerührt werden. Die Trud würde sonst eine alte Frau verwirren, die durch die Stubentüre einträte. Besonders zu vermeiden waren Wegekreuzungen, da einem dort die Ohrfeigen um den Kopf flögen.
Die Ereignisse der "zwölf Nächte" wurden bis zu Beginn des letzten Jahrhunderts auf verschiedene Weise gedeutet. So hieß es, wer in dieser Zeit niesen musste, lebte noch ein Jahr. Trug man einem Mädchen Misteln ins Haus, wurde sie im kommenden Jahr Braut. Was man in diesen Nächten träumte, wurde bald wahr.

description.hltext_display: Школярі з Івано-Франківська на Різдво колядуватимуть у Берліні
description.content:
Українські колядки та віншування почують у Німеччині. Мешканцям передмість Берліна їх заспівають івано-франківські школярі.
Напередодні запрошення виступити від української діаспори у Німеччині отримали місцеві освітяни.
7 січня учнівська делегація разом з учителями – всього 20 людей – вирушить до Берліна, – повідомила заступник начальника міського управління освіти та науки Світлана Уварова.
Колядуватимуть місцеві школярі у Німеччині цілий тиждень, – повідомляє ТРК «Вежа».

description.hltext_display: Evonik expands laurolactam capacity
Tiburon body kits - go well beyond the ordinary
description.content: If you want to own a car that is special you should look to have a car that is not just better than ordinary but rather there is a huge gap between the car and ordinary cars. And if you own a car that is already above the ordinary you can make it a truly special one with the help of car body kits. Take for example a car such as the Hyundai Tiburon. Though it is an affordable car it is also a car that goes beyond the average car. It has great styling and based on its performance and looks it can rub shoulders with the best cars in its category. And if you take the time and effort to do it up with Tiburon body kits you can have a very special car for yourself. Body kits are not very expensive and yet they have a great impact on the looks of your car therefore they give you great value for your hard earned money. The basic options are modifying the front and rear bumpers which by itself can give a big boost to the styling and make the car look more curvy. You can also add components such as side skirts and a car spoiler. A car spoiler is a very visible modification and actually gives dual benefits. It not only enhances the looks of the car but it also improves the aerodynamics of the car. It produces a downward force which increases with speed and at high speeds this downward force is significant and makes the car hug the road more. This makes your drive more stable at high speeds which is great. You should choose a light weight material for the body kits if you are keen to keep up its performance. Heavier materials will weigh down the car and could significantly affect its performance. You can of course choose colors and styles that are to your taste. In fact you can also see examples of similar cars that have been done up by going online. You should take care to have the body kits installation done by a professional. You can see the latest Tiburon body kits at www.ilovebodykits.com .

description.hltext_display: To Celebrate the end of Larry King Live, the Executive Producer will...
description.content:
Wendy Walker is the woman behind the man who has ultimately defined what it means to interview and now, only through the magic of Facebook, fans have this unique opportunity to “speak” one-to-one with her. It’s the audiences’ chance to ask the questions. Along with sharing knowledge and factoids about the show, Wendy can also answer questions about her own career and how she went from working as a sales person at Brooks Brothers to becoming one of the top news producers in television. It’s been a great 30-year journey and Wendy is open to sharing her stories, personal insights and empowering advice. Just ask!
About Wendy Walker
Broadcast news veteran and CNN Senior Executive Producer WENDY WALKER has held a front row seat to the world's stage for the past thirty years. The longtime senior executive producer of Larry King Live, Walker is the force behind television icon Larry King, and is a CNN original, joining the network when it began in 1980. Wendy has won a number of important awards in her career, including an Emmy and the First Amendment Service Award. From statesmen and world leaders, to celebrities and everyday people doing extraordinary things-Walker has covered them all as she created some of the most remarkable, famous, and history-making moments in television. Wendy shares her behind the scenes stories, personal insights & empowering advice from over 30 years as a high powered series producer in her memoir ‘Producer: Lessons Shared from 30 Years in Television’.

description.hltext_display: Storm triggers high flows in the Yuba: VIDEO
description.author: Kyle Magin Staff Writer
description.content:
ENLARGE
High water rushes under the Old Highway 49 bridge northwest of Nevada City Tuesday as an amateur photographer looks on.
Photo for The Union by John Hart
Recent winter storms gave the South Yuba River a slightly unusual look early this week.
Instead of its normal, slow-paced fall and winter pace, when the river's waters are low enough to expose even medium-sized boulders, the Yuba screeched over nearly every obstacle in its course, flowing at more than six times its seasonal average.
Rainstorms moved through the area starting late last week and stretching through the weekend, dropping 6-8 inches of rain in western Nevada County.
Snow levels varied from as low as 4,500 feet up to 7,000 feet as subtropical and arctic air masses passed over the region, according to National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration forecasters.
The South Yuba's high flow was “all rain runoff from the storms,” said Nevada County Consolidated Fire Chief Tim Fike. “The snow on anything below 5,000 feet washed off into it, combined with all the rain that fell.”
The website www.Dream flows.com, which monitors regional rivers, stated the South Yuba was running at 6,750 cubic feet per second Monday, up from the 1,000 cfs that is typical for this time of year, Fike said. By Tuesday, the river was back down to 3,000 cfs, still high for this time of year.
Emergency personnel are keeping a close eye on tributary streams such as Wolf Creek in Grass Valley and Deer Creek in Nevada City for potential flooding, Fike added.
To contact Staff Writer Kyle Magin, e-mail kmagin@theunion.com or call (530) 477-4239.
